children.text: "We’re in the 16th arrondissement, steps from Jardins du Trocadero and Trocadero Metro stop. The Eiffel Tower is a kilometer away and we're less than 10 minutes from the Arc de Triomphe, Champs-Elysees, and Bois de Boulogne." -
Hilton

negatives: Hotel does not have ice machines, was instructed to get ice from the bar or have it delivered to the room for 7 euros.
Small gym with 2 treadmills and 2 bikes and a few free weights.
Booked stay on points (240k) & during check-out was told we had to pay the 8,13€ per person, per night, city tax which was not disclosed during check-in.
positives: Eiffel tower views, close to a metro station.
Staff at the restaurant was exceptional.
Bed was comfortable however the pillows were too soft.
Breakfast was good. Able to order al a carte items as well as use the buffett.
The room had floor to ceiling windows as well as a door that could be opened onto a "balcony". The room also looked into the interior of the hotel which was decorated with greenery.
title: Canopy by Hilton Paris Trocadero

children.text: After a Eurostar delayed & a confusing experience at Gare du Nord I had written Paris off before it even began. Thankfully the Canopy by Hilton Paris Trocadero helped pull me from the edge. It has a great location with views of the Eiffel tower & an amazing breakfast buffet (free for Hilton Gold members). With rates over €400 per night we were glad to be able to leverage 80k points per night for our 3-night stay.
Strangely, on the hotel website, the rooms are labeled as
King Room ADA
King Room, no Fireplace
King Room, w/Fireplace
While on third-party booking sites, the rooms are labeled as
Superior Room
Deluxe Room
Classic Room
"Rustic mountain inn offering country-style rooms, some with fireplaces, plus a kitchenette & BBQs. " -
The Creekstone Inn

negatives: Wifi was not password protected.
No onsite restaurant or store.
No (free) water is provided for guests.
No elevator for the two-floor hotel.
9 rooms located across 2 floors (3 on 1st, 6 on 2nd).
The room doors don't have peepholes, we can't see who is knocking before opening the door.
The walls are thin, you can hear neighbors' TV.
There is no electric car charging station on site.
The hotel does not have a front desk, check-in is done electronically.
positives: Big TV with Chromecast functionality with the ability to stream YouTube (unlike at many hotel chains).
Spacious room with comfortable bed.
The room had a working fireplace.
Digital lock with a keypad for front door and room.
Close to Idyllwild town center (15-minute walk).
A small breakfast (coffee & individual pastries) is included in the room rate.
The staff was responsive to text inquires.
title: The Creekstone Inn Review

children.text: Booked a two-night stay in a Superior Room at the Creekstone Inn through Chase Travel for $525.84. Note this 9-room hotel has a 2-night minimum during the weekend.
Great location within walking distance to the town center, yet far enough for quiet nights, would definitely stay here again when we are in the Idyllwild area.

Our most anticipated stay of the year: 4 nights at Alila Ventana Big Sur. After flying into Oakland airport, we walked over to the Hertz counter to pick up our rental car. At the counter, the woman pointed us to a row of cars and told us to select one. After scanning the row of Hyundai Elantras, Nissan Altimas, and Toyotas we picked a 2021 Toyota Prius to take us on the 32-mile journey for our one-night stay at the Hyatt Centric Mountainview, further on the 120-mile journey to the Ventana Big Sur. After turning onto Coast Ridge Rd, we drove up to the front gate. We were greeted by an attendant who confirmed our reservation & then opened the gate for us to enter (when unattended there is a call box you can use to reach the front desk who can also open the gate). We drove up the windy, very small road to the valet station. The valet greeted us, reconfirmed our reservation & ushered us up the stairs to the Sur House for check-in. At check-in, we were provided a glass of wine & were given a map along with an overview of the property. Check-in was wonderful as we were one of two couples in the Social House. It was intimate and very informative. After check-in, we walked less than 1 minute to our Big Sur Villa, Room 23. This room is located in the building to the right of Social House, which made for a short walk to the pool & lawn seating areas.

The Big Sur Villa is "bi-level accommodation with plenty of room to roam". Downstairs there is an outdoor patio, a living room with a fireplace along with a dining area equipped with a Nespresso machine, a sink, ample storage & a mini-fridge. Upstairs there is a very comfortable King bed, two outdoor terraces along with a bathroom equipped with dual vanity, a soaker tub & a shower. At over 900 sq feet, the room was bigger than many NY apartments and was quite comfortable for our 4-night stay.

In the room was an Ipad, that could be used to order food (during our stay the hotel was all-inclusive), request housekeeping, or check your folio. Each night, we ordered in-room dining for breakfast the next morning, with the food arriving promptly at the scheduled time. After we were settled in the room, we headed out on the 0.5-mile walk to the Sur House for dinner. Prior to arrival, we received an email requesting our preferred dinner time & we selected 530pm. The walk from the room to the restaurant was through the Redwoods & absolutely breathtaking. There were chairs placed along the 0.5 walks if you needed to sit & the hotel also offered a service to help those unable to walk to the restaurant. Upon arrival, we were greeted, checked in & brought outside to the leftmost table facing the ocean. I would highly recommend coming to dinner early to ensure you can select this table which allows for endless views, as well as once the sun sets, the outdoor temperature rapidly drops. The staff has heat lamps by each table and will hand out blankets, however, the cold will still cut through you.

excerpt: Park Hyatt Jakarta features 220 rooms as well as luxury hotel dining and entertainment options. Our hotel will be a haven for intimate and stylish events including weddings, corporate functions, and social gatherings.

children.text: "With 59 secluded suites featuring expansive balconies, 160 magnificent acres of natural splendor on the rugged Pacific coast, and amenities and activities both private and purposeful, Ventana embodies the notion that space is luxury.
This is a place where everyone can find what they seek, from romance and emotional connection to perspective and solitary reflection."
Alila Ventana Big Sur

negatives: Internet was sporadic, not too big of a deal as we came here to explore the outdoors. Might be an issue if you come here planning on working remotely.
positives: Location, location, location: "Window" into Big Sur & its beauty. Close to Pfeiffer State Park & Pfeiffer Beach, with access to many other hiking trails. Great home base after exploring the outdoors.
Not usually a fan of the "log cabin" aesthetic, truly loved the room decor that paid homage to the surroundings in a clean and modern way.
Meal-inclusive package, where alcohol is not included. Note: this is a temporary perk, added due to COVID.
Nice room with a comfortable bed. Hooray for an in-room Nespresso & double sinks!

Wonderful staff. Everyone we interacted with was pleasant and super accommodating. From Michael & Richard during dinner service to Thomas & Ramiro during lunch. There are many ways to contact guest services, you can use the in-room tablet, use the in-room rotary phone, or text.
title: Ventana Big Sur Review

children.text: We spent 30k points per night for our 4-night stay where cash rates are upwards of $3,000/night. Having Hyatt Globalist we were upgraded to a Big Sur Villa, their 930 - 1,198 square foot bi-level suite, which was a treat. Overall great stay would definitely return.

"JW Marriott Marquis Miami infuses sophistication, design, art, fashion, and technology into a diverse landscape of business, meeting, and pleasure travel pursuits. Located in the heart of downtown Miami, close to the city's exciting Wynwood Art District, the Frost Science Museum, the Perez Art Museum, and the world-renowned Miami Design District." -
JW Marriott Marquis Miami

negatives: The walls are thin, can hear neighbors' TV, and people walking through the hallway.
The in-room fridge is a stocked mini-bar; there’s no place to store personal items.
No available tea kettle, so housekeeping brought hot water in carafes each time we wanted to make a cup of tea.
The room has visible wear and tear.
The bed was moderately comfortable, however, the pillowtop mattress cover kept sliding off & had to be reattached.
$25 (plus tax) destination fee
The property has a small pool.
A key card needs to be in the room slot to activate the lights
The mounted TV does not swivel making it hard to see from the seating area

The valet/parking situation is a hot mess. The parking space is limited, and can accommodate roughly 10 cars in two lanes. When cars are parked on the right-hand side, traffic moves at a snail's pace when folks are checking in and out.
The hotel has ongoing construction with scaffolding which deters from the hotel's outward appearance.
positives: Good location close to Brickell (across the bridge) and downtown Miami.
Great engaging staff, Mohammed at the front desk was very personable & provided an overview of the hotel at check-in.
Large bathroom with double vanity, soaker tub & shower. The water pressure was great & warmed up quickly.
Nice views of the bay (in between apartment complexes).
Large gym with plenty of equipment. There’s a gym studio with on-demand fitness classes.
In-room amenities included a robe and coffee machine. Requested 2nd robe and two pairs of slippers which were promptly delivered.
The hotel has an available text feature via the Marriott Bonvoy app allowing for easy communication.
title: JW Marriott Marquis Miami Review

children.text: Definitely, an older property, however, this property is nicer and more updated than the
JW Marriott Miami
At check-in, after I told Mohammed I had previously stayed at the attached
Beaux-Arts

boutique hotel, he said that while the JW was nice, it was not that nice and to taper my expectations by not comparing the two. We used 40k points for a one-night stay when cash rates were $300/night. In the future, at the $300 price point, I would stay at Beaux-Arts, an updated property, with access to the same facilities.

negatives: Could hear street noise from our 7th-floor room, late at night.
The sheet set (w/ duvet) was thin & not as soft as expected.
positives: Spacious suite with 1.5 bathrooms.
Walking distance to the Ferry Building.
Close to train station [Embarcadero]
title: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Review

children.text: Great room in a great part of San Fran. Ideal place for a hotel "home base". We paid $182.37 (total) for the one night and being a Hyatt Globalist was upgraded to the Balcony Suite. For San Fran prices this stay was reasonable & the room was well designed to maximize space. If we needed to stay close to Embarcadero, would definitely stay here again.

"Mandarin Oriental, Miami is a unique urban resort located on the three-acre, exclusive island of Brickell Key. Providing lush open spaces and light sea breezes, the Five-star hotel and spa offer an ideal location within walking distance of the finest shopping, dining, and nightlife experiences in Miami while providing the ultimate tranquil oasis for an escape. All guestrooms and suites come equipped with private balconies from which guests can enjoy stunning views of Biscayne Bay or Brickell Skyline. The hotel also boasts high-energy Food & Beverage concepts with breathtaking views and alfresco options." -
Mandarin Oriental Miami

negatives: Safe in the closet is at an awkward angle.
Wifi is slow (7 Mbps).
The pool is small and the hot tub was closed.
The balcony has a ledge that we kept tripping on.
TV response time was slow. When you turned it on you would wait up to 30 seconds for it to register & then another 30 seconds for it to turn on
positives: Exceptional service. Across the board, everyone we encountered went above and beyond our expectations.
Great location in Brickell Key.
Spacious Junior Suite with comfy sofa & soaker tub.
Million dollar bay view.
Twice daily housekeeping & turndown service.
Nice-sized gym with plenty of equipment.
Large, comfortable bed. Requested firm pillows which were placed in the room upon arrival.
I was able to communicate via text & the staff was very responsive.
Ample storage including a bath cart which housed additional towels.
Large lobby with floor-to-ceiling windows with expansive bay views.
In-room amenities included plush robes, comfy slippers that didn't disintegrate after 1 wear, and water was provided in glassware.
Great-tasting food (breakfast & dinner)
title: Mandarin Oriental Miami Review

children.text: Book a stay through Mandarin Oriental's "One More Night" promotion, which offered a complimentary third night when you book three nights. Under their Fans of MO program our booking came with daily breakfast ($83), one time dining credit ($100) and a late check-out (1pm).

My friend spoke highly of the MO Miami for years and I was excited for our three night stay there. We had a wonderful time and now have a new bar for luxury hospitality. Excited for our upcoming stay at MO New York in the fall.

Inspired by the city’s pioneering past and a local culture that is forever moving forward, The Trade an Autograph Collection® Hotel by Marriott pays homage to the hardworking history and modern spirit of today’s Milwaukee. -
Hotel of Deer District

negatives: Slow response to in-app communication.
Check-in ends at midnight, and due to flight delays, we arrived later than expected. Contacted them before midnight to be checked in. Upon arrival, provided ID & was given room keys.
The hotel did not have a pool.
Only 3 elevators, and after the Celtics v Bucks game, there was a long line to use them.
positives: Ideal location if attending an event at the Fiserv Forum.
The front desk & housekeeping staff were friendly.
The bed was comfortable & on the firmer side, which I prefer. Provided with 4 pillows, per Queen bed, ranging in firmness.
The room had a coffee machine, fridge, 1 robe while lacking slippers, bathroom amenities (toothbrush, toothpaste, mouthwash, shower cap)
Spacious gym, located on the 3rd floor, with several rowers, 2 Pelotons, 1 Stairmaster, 1 rower, along with free weight.
We ordered takeout from Craft, the hotel lobby restaurant and it was very good.

children.text: Avoid the "Craft" restaurant and bar one hour before any event at Fiserv Forum as it gets very busy.

title: Trade Hotel: An Autograph Collection Hotel by Marriott Review

children.text: Booked a 2-night stay to attend the Celtics v Bucks game. Perfect location for quick access to Fiserv Forum.

Nice, new hotel built with NBA players in mind with high ceilings & wide hallways. With a few tweaks to the in-room amenities (add slippers & toiletries) & faster communication, it could be a highly-ranked mid-level hotel in Milwaukee.

The Hotel Figueroa is a historic boutique hotel nestled in the heart of downtown Los Angeles near the fashion district. Opened in 1926 as a female-only hostel, it offered women the rare freedom to live unrestrained lives. Over ninety years later, the hotel continues as the city’s proud hub for creativity. -
Hyatt

negatives: Room AC unit was not working. Engineering came & was unable to fix. Hotel provided space heaters & extra blanket for the duration of our stay.
Small gym. Website said it has 2 treadmills, however there was only 1 when we arrived.
No Globalist upgrade offered at check-in; received the room I booked.
Limited breakfast options on a special "globablist" menu; hotel utilizes a coupon per person per day system.
Two slow elevators for the 14 floors. Being on the 4th floor we utilized the stairs during our stay.
Daily $30 destination fee (waived for our stay). Hyatt's website & the hotel's website listed different amenities here: https://www.hotelfigueroa.com/faq/
Couch & pillows were softer than preferred. King bed felt small.
Room does not have a desk, so would not stay here if I needed to work from the room. Note there is ample seating on the lobby floor near Cafe Fig
positives: Large corner 1 bedroom suite, with dual vanity in bathroom.
Unique hotel with rich history, we loved the Spanish architecture.
Good location close to Grammy Museum, LA Convention Center & Crypto.com Arena.
Close to many restaurants & shopping (including Target, Bath & Body Works, & Uniqlo).
Cafe Fig has a great Happy Hour (Monday to Fridays), just wished there were more than 4 cocktail options available.
title: Hotel Figueroa Hotel Review

children.text: For our first time in DTLA, we stayed at
JW LA Live in September 2021
. For our second time in DTLA, for a game, we decided to try out Hotel Figueroa.
Nice boutique hotel with pleasant staff & a good location (walkable to arena). The rooms are rather small so we intentionally booked a 1 bedroom suite for more space.
Would definitely stay here again when in DTLA.

negatives: Barn door bathroom (a negative for some due to lack of privacy).
Not much is within walking distance, definitely need a car to get around
positives: Large, clean modern room with a comfortable (firm) bed.
Lounge access for Gold members.
Good location, close to a shopping center, gas station, interstate, and a beach.
In-room coffee machine (not a Nespresso/Keurig)
title: San Diego Marriott Del Mar Hotel Review

children.text: Stayed here for 3 nights & did not have time to explore the nearby Torrey Pines Reserve or the beach. The hotel is in a plaza with other hotels including the Residence Inn Del Mar, the Hampton Inn Del Mar & a Double Tree by Hilton which are budget options in a great location.
I would definitely stay here again; the lounge, though small, had a good variety of food & was kept clean.

negatives: Expensive: $217 (room + tax) & $17 parking
No complimentary in-room water (flavored water available at the front desk)
At 3:45 pm, the room was not available. (4 pm check-in)
positives: Great downtown location, close to restaurants & activities
Comfy bed; friendly staff
Delicious restaurant (The Shore Room)
Non-casino hotel
title: Renaissance Reno Downtown Hotel & Spa  1 Bedroom Suite Review

children.text: Stayed here for a night while attending a Reno Philharmonic event happening in the hotel. Nice hotel in a good location with a high price tag. Would stay here again if there was a deal.

"The JW Marriott Miami is located in the heart of Brickell, Miami's hot destination for dining, shopping, and nightlife, and is located a short walk away from the city's newest shopping and entertainment destination, Brickell City Centre. The sophisticated business hotel boasts 296 guest rooms, the latest technology, and over 25,000 sq ft of flexible and recently redesigned meeting space." -
JW Marriott Miami

negatives: No in-room fridge for personal items, the fridge in the room is a stocked minibar
One robe in the room (requested a 2nd which was promptly delivered).
The bathroom was small, with one sink & a tub/shower combination that was difficult to get in and out of.
No water view and the room looks out at the nearby hotel pool.
In the room coffee machine did not go to sleep and flashed a light during the night.
The motion-activated light in the bathroom was unable to be turned off or dimmed. It was very bright & along with the flashing Illy night, which was very disruptive to the sleep cycle.
The pillows were soft & did not provide adequate support.
The room was outdated with visible wear & tear.
The bed was not comfortable, high partner motion transfer.
Windows are not soundproofed, could clearly hear music from cars on the street, 21 floors below.
The lounge was not frequently stocked. At noon it was out of coffee cups & guests were bringing cups from their rooms to use in the lounge.
positives: Early check-in (9 am) provided.
Good location in Brickell, close to Brickell City Centre & restaurants.
Upgraded to lounge access room (21st floor).
Key card activated elevator.
Gym, while small, is open 24 hours. Note you have to walk through the spa to access.
Fast wifi (100+ Mbps).
The front desk staff was nice during check-in.
The room was spacious and had a desk, chair & Illy coffee machine
title: JW Marriott Miami Review

children.text: Spent 40k points on a one-night stay during our two weeks in Miami. While the staff was attentive and courteous, the dated room made the stay feel more like a Holiday Inn than Marriott's luxurious JW brand. Rooms on the 7th floor are updated and bookable as an "Inspired" Guest Room. For 40k points or less than $250 a night, I would book a stay in the Inspired room instead.
After two days in LA, we took
Amtrak Pacific Surfliner
South to spend two days in San Diego. For our first night, we stayed at the Manchester Grand Hyatt San Diego.

We used a Hyatt free night certificate to book a standard King Room & were upgraded to a King Bay view room during check-in. Our 31st-floor room felt very spacious, even at just 340 sq feet, equipped with two seating areas, a coffee machine, a desk, and a mini-fridge.
After settling in and taking some photos, we headed upstairs to the 40th floor to check out their rooftop bar,
Top of Hyatt

. We stepped off the elevator at 4:40 (40 minutes after opening), walked around the corner and the place was packed. We promptly turned around, still in shock at how busy it was, deciding to check out both pools and the gym. At check-in, Jasmine informed us about the 4th-floor all-ages pool & warning us to avoid it based on the number of families with children she had checked in that day. While the 4th-floor
pool

was bigger (than the 3rd-floor adult-only pool), it was also filled to the brim with people. There were few towels left & no available seating. My anxiety was at an all-time high just walking past this pool to the gym, with so many people.
The gym was large, with free weights, a section with mats, two assault air runners, a Peloton bike & a wall of treadmills & ellipticals.
We walked the 0.6 miles to
Carnita's Snack Shack

EMBARCADERO location to grab a late lunch/early dinner. Have you ever been so hungry you ordered way too much food? Yeah, that's what happened to us. In hindsight, the Taco Box would have been more than enough. Somehow we misunderstood that the "Taco Box" of 4 tacos and nachos was meant to feed a family (
hence the name)
, thus it would have been plenty for both of us.

In addition to the "Taco Box", we ordered the "Smokey Pig Sandwich", which was delicious several hours later as a hotel late-night snack. With full bellies, we ventured back to the hotel, stopping to enjoy a beautiful San Diego sunset.
The next morning, we woke up & headed downstairs for breakfast. When we got off the elevator, there was a sign highlighting the
breakfast buffet options

We joined a line to check in & then waited to be seated. Although the area was filled, I must applaud the staff for having a system in place that kept things moving. We were in line for 11 minutes, before we were seated and the whole breakfast (joining the line, getting food, eating & closing out check) took 57 minutes. We arrived at breakfast at 10 am, and in the future, would recommend coming closer to 1045 as when we left, there was no line to check-in & the dining hall was about half full. After being seated outside (per our request), we ventured back inside to join the omelet station line. This is the only station where staff served patrons, in the time of COVID I would have preferred for the hotel to have staff still serving patrons all dishes rather than the current self-serve model. At a minimum for the hotel to offer patrons disposable gloves to use to touch the tongs. At $32 per person, the breakfast buffet was lacking, as a Globalist this was included in our stay at no additional cost, so I did not feel too bad about just getting an omelet with orange juice.

After breakfast we took a stroll to explore the area, stopping at Extraordinary Desserts, and stumbling upon a sort of farmer's market back in Embarcadero. With a 4 pm check-out, we were then off to our second San Diego hotel, the Andaz San Diego.

negatives: Buffet breakfast was limited & pricey, costing $32/per person plus tax. During COVID it was also uncomfortable to watch throngs of people handle the same tongs.
Small bathroom with shallow tub & sink
The bed was meh (3/5), the pillows were lumpy & did not provide adequate support.
positives: Great service: Jasmine at check-in was professional, courteous & helpful.
The hotel has several restaurants & a lobby store with snacks
Good location close to the marina, with tons of restaurants & activities nearby.
title: Manchester Grand Hyatt San Diego Review

children.text: I've come to realize my sweet spot for hotels is 200 - 600 rooms. The boutique feels with enough amenities to make things enjoyable. With a great location & awesome staff, the more than 1,600-room Manchester was just too big for me.
We used a free night certificate for this stay, as rates for the night were upwards of $600. If given the choice I might look to stay somewhere else in the same area in the future.

"Tru by Hilton York has relaxed rooms and features complimentary Wi-Fi and flat-screen TVs, as well as minifridges.

Parking and a breakfast buffet are complimentary. There's an informal dining area, a gaming area, and a fitness room, in addition to a 24-hour mini-mart offering beer and wine." ~ Tru by Hilton

negatives: The rooms are small.
No in-room safe for valuables.
The hotel did not have a pool
Breakfast was limited to a lot of  carbs; it would not be substantial for anyone with dietary restrictions
positives: Great staff: everyone we encountered went above and beyond to ensure we had a good stay
Clean, functional room with plenty of power outlets.
Comfortable King bed with firm pillows.
Lemon bathroom liquid hand soap that smelled amazing.
Loved that the bathroom came with a night light! Such a simple item, that made a huge impact.
Great location close to the highway, gas station, Starbucks & several restaurants.

The common area was a great place for our group to gather & eat home-cooked meals. Our group brought in crockpots of food & had plenty of outlets to plug into. We utilized the hotel's paper products & microwave.
title: Tru by Hilton York Review

children.text: First time staying
@trubyhilton
& definitely not our last.

Located just minutes from the Chicago O'Hare Airport and a short walk from the Blue Line “L Train" offering easy access to downtown Chicago and all the excitement of the city. The hotel is situated in Rosemont featuring the Village of Rosemont which includes Parkway Bank Park, Allstate Arena, the Fashion Outlets of Chicago and more. -
Westin O'Hare

negatives: Check-in agent was abrupt & did not provide any information about the hotel. Minimal interaction with other hotel staff.
Bathroom handheld shower leaks too much for it to be used.
Our TV was not working when we came in, the staff came in to fix it after waiting 30 minutes.
Keycard not needed for the elevator, a safety concern.
At first glance, the 2020 renovations looks good. After a few minutes, you notice the scuff marks & the old bones that still exist.
It was difficult to connect to the wifi, which once connected was slow (10 mbps)
There's only night stand and there is no master light switch available next to the beds. You have to turn off the master by the front door.
The bathroom automatic nightlight stayed on too long, especially during the night.
positives: Complimentary airport shuttle, which was efficient located at Terminal 2.
Rooms were priced at $280 per night, we used 1 Free Night Award & 30k points for our 2-night stay. The day of our stay, room was listed as 29k points.
Good location in Rosemont, close to airport & a few restaurants.
Hotel has a full Starbucks in the lobby, which closes at 2 pm on the weekend, which was strange.
Comfortable bed with a sleep well balm available for use.
The room is spacious with the two Queens and we loved that the desk had wheels & was easily movable.
Staff responded promptly to inquiries via the "chat with us" feature in the app.
title: The Westin O'Hare Hotel Review

children.text: We needed a place to stay after a red-eye, where we used 30k points and a free night award. With a free airport shuttle, a recent renovation & location close to shops, it is a great 'airport' hotel base.

negatives: No pool or spa is available at the hotel.
No robes or slippers were provided in the room (could be requested).
The bathroom design was not functional (no shower wall to prevent leaking, which resulted in a pool of water in the bathroom after each shower).
The hotel has 4 elevators to service 21 floors which resulted in frequent waiting. We were on the 5th floor and used the staircase instead.
positives: Great location: across the street from the Manhattan Bridge pedestrian path; less than half a mile to the Canal Street subway station.
Modern updated rooms, with great artwork. Concrete walls which might be a negative to some.
Courteous staff: Hotel has a texting system to which they were very responsive.
2nd-floor lounge area: great space with coffee & tea along with utensils & a microwave.
title: Hotel 50 Bowery Review

children.text: This was a
phenomenal
stay in a great hotel..
We had to downgrade our room as it was not available when we arrived at 9 am. The king-standard room was nice, definitely wished we had a couch to lounge on though.

The hotel is in the heart of Chinatown, with an amazing rooftop bar (The Crown). They allowed us to "visit" for a bit, however in order to order we needed a reservation which came with a $75 per person minimum.
For $101/night (plus taxes), this hotel was a great find & we will definitely return.

Escape to the San Diego coast of Carlsbad and experience Park Hyatt Aviara, a AAA Five-Diamond and Forbes Five-Star luxury resort. Minutes from LEGOLAND® California and the Pacific Coast sandy beaches, our spa and golf resort getaway offers world-class recreation and relaxation amid 200 lush acres of natural beauty overlooking the Batiquitos Lagoon. -
Hyatt

negatives: Location is secluded. You will need a car (& pay the $65 per night parking fee) or take an Uber to go to restaurants or shopping.
There were suites available when we checked-in however we were not offered a suite upgrade.
positives: Two weeks prior to check-in received welcome email with links to activities & spa (https://linktr.ee/parkhyattaviara)
Booked a 2 King Bed and received a complimentary upgrade to 2 Kings Foothills View via Hyatt Prive booking.
Large sized gym with free weights & many machines, including a Peloton. The gym also has a room with open floor that I used for stretching and Farmer's carry.
Two pools with nice views.
Le Labo bathroom amenties in full size bottles. There was note that said a $120 charge would be added to folio if bottles were removed from the room.
Dinner in Ponto Lago was the highlight of our stay.
title: Park Hyatt Aviara Hotel Review

children.text: Great hotel for a quick weekend gateway from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Such a hassle to figure out how to get from the airport to Waikiki. We looked at the Hawaii Tourism website along with watching some YouTube videos and made a reservation with Johnny Cab. As a backup, the hotel texted us that there were shuttle buses near the baggage claim that could take us to Waikiki. In the end, Jonny Cab worked perfectly and on our next visit we might just take "The Bus".
"Immerse yourself in the welcoming spirit of Aloha at Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach. Ideally located in the heart of Waikiki, just off some of the
most beautiful beaches in the world
, and near countless island-inspired eateries and natural wonders, you’ll quickly discover this explorer’s paradise on O'ahu" -
Hyatt

negatives: Water filtration system & ice located on 1st, 7th, and 19th floor. Not an issue as our room was on the 19th floor.

Hotel restaurant is closed, as a Hyatt Globalist, I was given 500 points per night for the duration of our stay. This gave us time to try different local restaurants for breakfast each day. Hawaiian Aroma Cafe was a quick 5-minute walk & had a delicious acai bowl. Liliha Bakery located in the nearby Royal Hawaiin Center offered sit down service and delicious pastries. Heavenly, across the street, offered online ordering which helped save time from waiting in the line that always formed from 630 to 10 am.
Booked through Hyatt Privé however, there was no welcome amenity, and the $25 F&B credit was applied towards the room rate as the restaurant was closed.
This office building converted into a hotel 5 years ago offered no balconies.
Our room did not have a desk; hotel photos showed similar rooms with desks, however, they did not have a couch. If I had to choose between a couch and a desk, I will choose a couch.
Wifi was okay (Fast.com showed 9.1 Mbps), which worked for browsing however trying to stream Sling to the hotel TV was rather sluggish.
Small shallow pool
No onsite spa (guests were instructed to utilize the Hyatt Regency Spa instead)
YouTube TV Chromecast functionality was not working (known Hyatt/YouTube API issue)
positives: Good location in Waikiki. Close to many shops, restaurants, the beach & the bus stop is a block away. Ross is a few steps away with reasonably priced items, note the ling to checkout was extremely long when we went in on a Thursday afternoon.
Good views. The oceanview room has floor-to-ceiling windows which provided amazing views of the coastline.
Attached to Starbucks Reserve, can use mobile ordering to skip the line
$33 daily resort - while annoying, this resort fee adds value to our stay, including a Go-Pro rental.
The staff is very friendly, from the front desk agents to housekeepers to the valet, everyone greeted us.
While the gym is small it has adequate equipment: two treadmills, one Peloton, one elliptical, and free weights.
The bed was comfortable, it had 4 pillows that were different firmness.
The room was spacious with plenty of storage. I would see no issues with storing a week’s worth of clothes in the room.
The bathroom was spacious with double vanity & large shower.
The hotel has 4 elevators and there was rarely a wait. A keycard was needed to access guest room floors.
Comfortable, warm robes were provided
The hotel provided daily housekeeping, a rarity I thought was limited to luxury, 5-star hotel brands.
Very responsive text feature; The 10 pm in-app requests for slippers and kettle were promptly delivered.
title: Hyatt Centric Waikiki Hotel Review

children.text: Booked under Hyatt Privé at $259/night. With great staff, great location, and modern spacious rooms, we would definitely stay here again.
Booked a "Deluxe King Room" DTLA Getaway Package for $189/night which came with a $50/nightly hotel credit. Checking the package on August 30th the nightly rate had increased to $294/night.
After flying into LAX airport, taking the LAX FlyAway bus to Union Station & then taking the number 28 bus (
which was free & I still don't know why

), we finally arrived at the JW Marriott LA Live. We waded past the LSU paraphernalia to get to the lobby check-in. Check-in was fast & prompt and we were given keys to room 1738, a Deluxe King City View room.
The hotel charges a $30/nightly destination fee that includes a
$20/night food & beverage credit,
2 tickets to the nearby Grammy Museum,
1 hour of bowling (& 2 rental shoes) at Lucky Bowling
Daily popcorn at the Regal Cinema (with popcorn voucher)
Daily yoga class
Daily wine tasting
Enhanced wifi (
same benefit for Gold members
After checking in & taking photos of the room, we ordered room service.
For our first meal, we spent $117, which was $87 for food & $31 in fees
Wagyu burger ($28)
Ceaser salad ($12)
Chicken wings ($16)
Pasta bolognese ($21)
Ginger Ales ($5)
Diet Coke ($5)
Hot water & 2 teacups ($0)
We were quoted a 30-minute wait time for our meal & it arrived in 20 minutes. All the food was delicious, my favorite was the pasta bolognese. I love fresh pasta & JW's Savoa restaurant is top-notch.
We ordered breakfast for our two mornings & both arrived promptly & were delicious.

This 17th-floor King room was very spacious & comfortable for our two-night stay. With great views of the Staples Center & LA convention center, the couch was a nice place to hang out after a day of exploring.
The TV allowed for YouTube streaming, and the bathroom shower had decent water pressure.

negatives: The bed was meh (rated 3/5), decent for 2 nights, but not as comfortable as other JW hotels.
The in-room coffee machine was subpar for the JW brand (Illy coffee stand in the lobby, Starbucks behind the hotel)
Small gym & small pool

$30 daily destination fee. While I appreciated the tickets to the Grammy Museum, not a fan of destination fees, especially since at check-in I was not informed about how to claim offers & had to come back downstairs to inquire & get the applicable vouchers.
The hotel did not notify us about hosting the LSU v UCLA game. The hotel was packed, causing lines to form, with little to no enforcement of the mask mandate (all staff were masked).
positives: Great location in downtown LA. Close to shops, restaurants, Staples Center & LA Convention Center.
Exceptional staff: fast response to requests, in-room dining arrived on time or earlier than quoted.
Great food: ordered dinner & breakfast & everything tasted great. Appreciated they offered in-room dining with plates & silverware.
Spacious room with a nice view (on the 17th floor)
title: JW Marriott Los Angeles L.A. Live Review

children.text: We paid $517 ($189/night + $30 daily destination fee & taxes) for our two-night stay. Overall a nice stay in downtown LA would stay again if less than $200/night, and they are not hosting an event after COVID things settle down.

negatives: Blackout curtains let in some light.
The room is small (~200 sq feet) & would be hard to maneuver with large checked suitcases & more than 2 adults.
You can hear hallway chatter & door closures.
The shower took a long time to heat up, we had to leave it running for a few minutes. It might be an issue during the winter months.
Slow Internet speed (8 mbps)
positives: Value: $200-night hotel close to Barclay's Center, booked last minute.
Friendly staff: Miracle at the front desk was very personable. We checked in via the app however our digital key was not working & had to get physical keys when we arrived.
Amenities: The hotel basement has a 24-hour workspace/game room, which also houses the small gym & offers complimentary coffee & tea.
Nearby shops: There are plenty of restaurants & shops nearby, notable Starbucks is a block away.
Comfortable bed
title: Tru by Hilton Brooklyn Hotel Review

children.text: We needed a hotel within walking distance of Barclay's & after initially booking a stay at the nearby TownePlace Suites, we saw the Tru was on the same block & for $200 less during our trip, so we switched. We've stayed at a Tru before & know they are a bare-bones Hilton brand which was perfect for our 2-night stay.

The Hyatt Regency Los Angeles International Airport hotel is located across the highway from Los Angeles International Airport. This contemporary hotel is 5 miles from Venice Beach and 12 miles from eateries and entertainment along Santa Monica Pier.

Featuring soundproof windows, modern rooms have free WiFi, flat-screen TVs, and coffeemakers. All offer work areas; suites (some with mini-fridges and microwaves) add separate sleeping and living space. In-room dining is available 24/7.

negatives: The bed was okay, the pillows were too soft.
TV started on the Windows screen & did not have Chromecast functionality.
Pricey for an airport hotel, range to upwards of $200 (plus taxes & fees) per night.
positives: Great location close to LAX airport
Nice staff, responsive to text message inquiries
Spacious room with table & couch. Double-paned windows (while dirty) kept most of the airport noise out.
Nice gym with runways views from the treadmill
room: 1 King Bed Runway View High Floor
title: Hyatt Regency Los Angeles International Airport Review

children.text: Quick overnight stay
@hyattregency_lax

. Booked a King Room & was upgraded to a King Runway View on the 8th floor. The hotel has 13 floors, with the Fitness Center & "city view" conference rooms on the 13th (Penthouse) floor. Overall we had a nice stay at the hotel & would stay here again if we had an early flight from LAX.
Check-in: After getting off at the Foggy Bottom  GWU Metro stop, we walked through GWU to head towards the hotel.
Upon arrival, there was no bellman at the door. As we let ourselves in, David from the front desk was walking towards us asking if we needed assistance with our luggage.

At the check-in desk, David noted were had been upgraded to a Park Junior Suite (also noted in the Hyatt app) on the 8th floor. We asked if the assigned room 1) had a view and 2) was a connecting room. David found us a new room on the 6th floor with a view however noting it was a connecting room. He was persistent & continued to search & finally found us a Park Junior Suite, with a view & a non-connecting room. David handed us two keys & directed us to the elevator.
Upon entering the room, the phone rang. It was David checking to see if we needed anything & informing us to call the front desk with any issues.
At 17:35 we called the front desk to see if there were any reservations available at Blue Duck Tavern & we were able to get an 1800 reservation.
This was a great way to start a great three (3) night's stay.

"Park Hyatt Washington D.C. is located in the West End neighboring Georgetown, Pennsylvania Avenue, and the White House. Savor Michelin distinguished food in Blue Duck Tavern while sipping exceptional wines, as you watch a dramatic culinary presentation in the open kitchen and wood-burning Molteni oven." - Park Hyatt

negatives: Windows need to be soundproofed, could hear street noise from the 9th floor.
The pool & gym are located on the "M" (2nd) floor however hotel signage says it is on the 3rd floor, which was a bit confusing.
The suite had a barn door between the living & bedroom, wish there was a locking door.
positives: Amazing, attentive staff.
Spacious Corner Park Junior Suite
In-room stocked Nespresso with green & black tea capsules
Fast, reliable WiFi (63 MB)
Globalist breakfast credit is $90 & we were able to sample many items from the menu during our 3-night stay.
title: Park Hyatt Washington D.C. Review

children.text: We spent $650 booking a 3rd-night free stay at Park Hyatt DC. Booked a 1 King Bed and was upgraded to a Park Junior Suite.
With a Georgetown location, great staff & delicious hotel restaurant Blue Duck Tavern, we would definitely stay here again.

Our luxury hotel in downtown Washington, D.C., is a few blocks from the National Mall, Smithsonian Museums, and historical monuments. Immerse yourself in the iconic sights, unlimited shopping, and alluring nightlife of the nation's capital. Whether you're visiting for business or pleasure, you'll enjoy exceptional comfort and service and a direct connection to the city via the Metro Center station. -
Hyatt

lounge: yes, paid or member only access
negatives: We were unable to check into our room until 745 p.m., nearly 4 hours after the 4 p.m. check-in time.
Large conference hotel with only 5 elevators, causing long wait times.
Our room looked into offices across the street. During the weekend not an issue, just something to be mindful of during the work week.

$20 daily destination fee (waived for Globalist), which included a $10 daily food & beverage credit from Cure, the hotel restaurant.

Full list of inclusions here: https://www.hyatt.com/en-US/hotel/washington-dc/grand-hyatt-washington/wasgh/policies.
Hotel offered a daily newspaper, which turned out to be 10 copies per day. Around 10am on Sunday during our stay I stopped by for a Sunday paper & was told they were all gone.
positives: Great location in central DC.
Large spacious suite with 1.5 bathrooms.
The lounge on the 12th floor is well-stocked & maintained. The lounge staff is very friendly & proactive in helping patrons & ensuring the lounge stays clean.
Dinner at Cure restaurant, while a bit pricey, was good.
Comfortable bed
Ample outlets
Chromecast functionality
Bathroom tub has whirlpool jets
title: Grand Hyatt Washington Review

children.text: We spent $1,131.68 ($282.92 per night) along with 24k points for a four-night stay in a Grand Suite. Due to issues during check-in (including the room not being ready 4 hours after check-in), the hotel credited back 15k points.
This category 4 hotel has direct access to the Metro center, a central DC location, and a great staff which makes it a nice option for a long weekend in DC.

The Ritz-Carlton Jakarta, Pacific Place is a 5-star luxury hotel located in the heart of Jakarta, Indonesia. The hotel offers spacious and elegant rooms and suites, as well as a variety of amenities, including a fine dining restaurant, a pool, and a spa. The hotel is also home to the Ritz-Carlton Club, which offers exclusive benefits to guests, such as complimentary breakfast, snacks, and drinks. The Ritz-Carlton Jakarta, Pacific Place is the perfect place to stay for business or pleasure, and offers guests an unforgettable experience of luxury and sophistication.

negatives: The hotel has old technology
positives: Location: The hotel is located in Pacific Place, a large mall in SCBD, filled with shops and restaurants.
The room was spacious and very clean upon arrival. Daily housekeeping and a nightly turn-down service were provided during our two-night stay.
Hotel service exceeded our expectations. A manager at Park Hyatt Jakarta, who previously worked at the Ritz, informed the General Manager of our arrival, which resulted in VIP treatment.
The points booking included a
title: The Ritz-Carlton Jakarta, Pacific Place

children.text: This is an excellent hotel in Jakarta. The staff was fantastic, they went way above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. Overall we had a wonderful time.   Highly recommended!

"This straightforward hotel set next to Harrisburg International Airport is 7 miles from Indian Echo Caverns and 4 miles from Frey Manor Park.

The relaxed rooms feature free Wi-Fi, flat-screen TVs and minifridges, plus microwaves, and tea and coffee-making facilities. Upgraded rooms add living areas.

Breakfast is complimentary (grab and go). Other amenities include a bar and a gym. Free parking is available."

negatives: No airport shuttle. It is a 5-minute partially covered walk from the hotel to the airport. With inclement weather, this could be a problem with luggage.

When we arrived we noticed that 75% of 2nd floor rooms were left partially opened, yet there was no housekeeping cart in the hallway. About 30 minutes later, housekeeping emerged from one of the rooms.
The 2nd-floor ice machine was not working, went to the 1st-floor to get ice.
This is a new airport hotel where the total price was $131.65.
Not much nearby. There's a gas station across the freeway, however not many other food options.
positives: Close to Harrisburg Airport (MDT)
Available coin laundry. There was 1 washer ($1.75 for 30 minutes) and 1 dryer ($1.50 for 30 minutes)
Grab & go breakfast included: yogurt, muffin, fruit, bottled water, granola bar, & a mint.
In-room microwave & mini-fridge.
title: Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott Harrisburg International Airport Review

children.text: Good hotel near Harrisburg airport. Would stay here again to provide ease of access for early AM flights.

"Your stylish base in the cosmopolitan heart of London, Hyatt Place London City East is close to the vibrant Brick Lane, Spitalfields Market, Tower of London and the artistic streets of Shoreditch." -
Hyatt

negatives: Walls are thin: can hear folks in the hallway.
The room is small with no drawers to unpack suitcase. Instead there was a luggage rack propped in the corner upon arrival.
Hotel has a small windowless gym that was quite stuffy.
Wifi was on the lower end, a bit slow for such a densely populated area.

Not enough power outlets in the room. There was only one side table with one outlet. The desk, on the opposite side of the bed, has two outlets and then's there one by the front door, that we used when we needed to iron.
Location is sketch, walking through lots of homeless & trash.
positives: Location: close to Aldgate East & Whitechapel Underground stations. Close to many shops & restaurants. 10 minute walk to Spitalfields Markat & Shoreditch.
Upgraded to a room with a step-up balcony. Nice to have some outdoor space.
Bed was comfortable, able to get sleep; albeit it was on the firm side.
No noise from 9th floor rooftop bar.
Included breakfast (Globalist) was good. Limited rotation so after a few days it would become boring.
TV had built-in Chromescast that sporadically would drop off while watching a video.
Staff was very friendly & accommodating. Was given 12 pm early check-in.
Booked for 9k points per night, where similar rooms were £600 per night. Great value on points, although the room was small.
room: 1 King Bed High Floor w/ Balcony | Room 809
title: Hyatt Place London City East Hotel Review

children.text: We need a central location, available on points for our 3-night stay. At 9k points per night, it was a steal of a deal. Staff is wonderful & it was a great base of a few days.

A towering icon within a vibrant Central Business District, Fairmont Austin is uniquely located in downtown Austin amid the greenery of Palm Park and Waller Creek. Our 37-story luxury hotel in Austin features 1,048 richly appointed guest rooms and suites with picturesque vistas of Austin's dramatic cityscape, Lady Bird Lake, and the State Capitol. At Fairmont Austin, indulge in premium amenities embodying all the finest qualities of a 4-star hotel in Austin. -
Fairmont Austin

lounge: yes, paid or member only access
negatives: Friday the alarm system was triggered on the 33th floor & the response was lackluster.
Room 3341 is across from the service elevator. Could hear loud noises as employees maneuvered through.
Room has visible wear & tear including ripped wallpaper & scuffed drawers & door frames.
Can hear street noise in the 33rd-floor room.
Bathroom did not have a rainfall or hand-held option.
Elevator key card can only be tapped on one side.
TV remote is slow to respond.
While the lounge food was good there were limited options. Saw same items for breakfast, canapes & dessert over the days.
Shower door didn't close all the way, resulting in water on the bathroom floor.
positives: Benjamin in the Gold Lounge is amazing. Very personable & helpful around the lounge.
Plush comfortable bed. Pillows were of varying firmness which allowed for a good night's sleep.
Spacious bathroom with water closet & large shower. Included Le Labo amenities (Rose 31)
Key card needed to access guest room floors.
Fairmont Gold room came with free premium wifi (23 Mbps)
Room has plenty of power outlets and USB charging (two per nightstand).
In room fridge is a paid mini fridge. Requested a fridge for personal items which was delivered promptly.
Large TV with Chromecast functionality which was easy to use.
Daily housekeeping & nightly turn down service.
Good selection of snacks & seating in the lounge, which was rarely at 25% occupancy the first two days. Next few days the lounge was busier. There was ample seating however it was not as quiet.
The hotel has 10 elevators divided into two sections allowing for fast access to higher floors.
Delicious freshly baked pastries in the lounge.

children.text: Upgrade to the Fairmont Gold room for a higher floor room with lounge access.

title: Fairmont Austin Texas

children.text: Nice hotel for a few days while attending a conference. Close to Austin Convention Center with plenty of shopping & restaurants nearby. Austin is a very walkable city & this is a great base hotel. We would likely only return if we needed to be in close proximity to the convention center. Will look for other hotels in Austin for our next stay.
The Hyatt Regency Lake Tahoe Resort (Presidential Suite) is an 896-square-foot one-bedroom suite with separate lavishly appointed sleeping and entertaining space, plus a large dining/meeting table.

negatives: While spacious, the suite did not have a dedicated dining room table.
The bedroom barn door does not have a locking mechanism.
positives: Soft King-sized bed
65” HD TV in the bedroom and 65” HD TV in the living room
Cozy gas fireplace
Mini fridge and wine fridge provided
Large bathroom in the bedroom and half-bath in the living room
Wifi speed was excellent, no lags or issues while on Zoom meetings.
title: Hyatt Regency Lake Tahoe Resort (Presidential Suite) Review

children.text: My new favorite room at my favorite hotel. The Presidential Suite is spacious, with two TVs, ample seating, and a large bathroom with double vanity & soaker tub. Great place to come back to after a day of skiing, or a cozy place to spend a snowy day indoors.
Opposite Bankers Life Fieldhouse arena, this informal hotel is a 7-minute walk from Indianapolis Union railway station, 2 miles from Indianapolis Zoo and a mile from White River State Park. -
Hyatt House Indianapolis/Downtown

negatives: A half bottle of Dr Pepper was in the fridge when we checked in, a cleanliness issue.
There were several homeless folks in the park near the transit center & police station on the walk to Whole Foods, a possible safety issue.
Street noise can be heard from the 6th floor room, might be bothersome to some especially when events are happening.
Valet parking is $43 per night.
Shower water pressure is low & Internet is slow (9 mbps).
3 days after checking out the stay had not posted to my Hyatt account & needed to be manually requested.
positives: Great location close to Gainbridge Fieldhouse.
Studio room is spacious with large spacious bathroom.
The hotel has a large gym along with coin-operated laundry with 2 washers & 2 dryers.
Staff is friendly & complimentary breakfast is available.
The hotel has 4 elevators that work efficiently. After the Fever game, there was a line & a bit of wait, which is to be expected.
Hotel has a [small above-ground indoor] pool.
room: Studio Kitchen Suite | King Bed (plus sofa bed) | Room 606
title: Hyatt House Indianapolis/Downtown Hotel Review

children.text: We were in town for a Fever WNBA game & the Hyatt House is located directly across the street, which is a huge plus. We paid $380 for our 2-night stay, and with a spacious studio wth a kitchenette, this is a great base to attend an event at Gainbridge. If doing other activities outside the area, I would stay somewhere else.

Shining bright in the skyline, Four Seasons Hotel Minneapolis is connected by Skyway to sports, business and entertainment and is two blocks from the Mississippi River. Inside, discover Mediterranean-inspired dining by award-winning local chef Gavin Kaysen, a wellness floor complete with indoor and outdoor pools and a Spa dedicated to nourishment through nature. -
Four Seasons Minneapolis

negatives: Can hear road noise from 24th floor room. Windows do not have adequate sound proofing.
Strangely the left corner of the window, behind the drapes looks into the adjacent room.
Nearby train station is a bit grungy & could be a safety concern for solo travelers.
positives: Great location close to train station, several restaurants, Whole Foods & the Target Center.
Spacious bathroom with a door for the water closet & shower; along with a tub & double vanity.
Sunday Brunch has good variety.
Comfortable bed, with firm pillows & automatic curtains.
Very personable staff; housekeeping & turn-down service were efficient.
Ample closet space, with several drawers available for use; room has a clothes steamer.
title: Four Seasons Minneapolis Hotel Review

children.text: Booked a "Third Night Free" ($360 per night) in March 2024 to see the Lynx play Liberty at the nearby Target Center. The T'Wolves made the Western Conference finals and ended up playing the Mavs during our stay, so we were able to see two basketball games, a real treat. The new Four Seasons Minneapolis is phenomenal & would stay here again.

negatives: Thin "walls": could hear the upstairs neighbor walking around, but didn't hear neighbors on our floor.
New hotel yet the bathroom hot water faucet "popped" out & was difficult to turn off.
Confusing light switches spent a few minutes trying to identify what turned on/off.
Windows don't open, the room was "warm" overnight.
positives: Great location: walking distance to Target, Trader Joe's, Walmart & Whole Foods
"Stylish" new hotel, spacious standard room floor plan.
Soft, comfortable bed
Free self-parking ($25 valet)
In-room Keurig with Dark Magic pods (my favorite)
title: Hyatt Centric Mountain View Review

children.text: Nice new (opened in 2019) hotel in a great location filled with shops & restaurants. Although the hotel has been open for a while, they still seemed to be working out the kinks.

For the price we paid of $109.24 (total) for our one-night stay, we would definitely stay here again, asking for a higher floor room. During summer this hotel costs upwards of $400/night (+tax) which definitely isn't worth it.

Booked a one-night stay in the Suite Bliss at the Grand Idyllwild Lodge directly for $324.50. Note this 12-room hotel has a two-night minimum with check-in Friday & Saturday, one-night with check-in Sundays through Thursdays.

While the room was spacious, the after-hour check-in process felt unsafe, and the breakfast was limited. I would stay here again if I was able to stay during the weekend with more breakfast options and check in between 3 - 5 pm to work with the staff.

" Nestled among the trees on over two acres of land, at an elevation of 5,600 feet, near Pine Cove, The Grand Idyllwild Lodge is an unforgettable boutique luxury lodge. Located at the “top of the town” this breathtaking lodge features panoramic views of the pristine, idyllic San Jacinto Mountains, including a majestic backdrop of the monoliths Lily Rock and Tahquitz Peak." -
The Grand Idyllwild Lodge

negatives: Doors don't have peepholes, can't see who is knocking before opening the door
After-hours check-in is an envelope with your name and room taped to the front door, which felt unsafe. (Albeit there was a ring camera, that hopefully was recording).
Minimal staff onsite, have to text/call with any issues.
The in-room fireplace was cosmetic, a possible pro for some.
positives: Spacious room with spacious bathroom.
The room has two comfortable seating at the foot of the bed.
Small boutique hotel with 12 rooms.
Great location in Idyllwild-Pine Cove. Close to Idyllwild town center, which is a 15-minute walk.
One one-site charge point.
Comfortable bed
Plenty of communal seating (inside and outside).
Breakfast included in rate.
While slow, the lodge has an elevator to access the 3 floors.
Putt-putt & outdoor swing
Fast internet (110 Mbps).
title: The Grand Idyllwild Lodge Review

children.text:
The Hotel Beaux Arts hotel is located in a glass and steel high-rise, this stylish hotel is a 10-minute walk from Bayfront Park and an 8-minute drive from American Airlines Arena.

Minimalist rooms and 1-bedroom suites offer ocean or bay views, as well as marble bathrooms, flat-screen TVs, and iPads. All also have free Wi-Fi and coffeemakers.

negatives: Weird check-in, this hotel is on the top 3 floors of the JW Miami Marquis & you need a key card to get to the 39th floor to check in. The JW front desk checked us in (after walking to the elevator & walking out after realizing we needed a key card).
Unlike Hyatt which doesn't charge resort fees on award bookings, I had to pay a $25 resort fee for services I never used.

Also unlike Hyatt where I don't pay for parking, valet parking here was $55 for the night. The attendant who helped us was not very attentive as they were on the phone (& stayed on the phone) when we pulled up. We read reviews that it takes about 30 minutes for the valet to get the car, so we requested it 30 minutes before we needed it & headed downstairs when they said it was ready. The entrance/valet is super small & gets a bit congested.
positives: Stylish room with great views & comfortable bed.
Large bathroom with spray jet bathtub
Plush bathrobes (& slippers)! So comfortable I considered buying them (but didn't since the suitcase had minimal space left).
Illy in-room coffee machine.
The front desk staff was nice & responsive.
title: Hotel Beaux Arts Review

children.text: Located on the top floors of the JW Marquis Miami, after living in South Florida for 7 years, finally got an opportunity to visit this hotel.
Used 40k points to book a Rockwell room & were upgraded to the O'Keefe. Nicely appointed room, with large bathroom with double vanity, soaker tub & shower.
Great use of 40k Marriott Bonvoy points, although I was still charged the resort & parking fee. Despite the awkward front desk situation, would definitely stay here again.

"Colorful and lively, Mandalay Bay’s resort, suite, and luxury collections offer more of everything you love. From larger spaces to natural wood and stone décor, these exotic retreats have all of the comforts of home. For the ultimate in indulgence, our one-to-four bedroom Luxury Collection also offers a true Las Vegas escape beyond your most extravagant expectations." -
Mandalay Bay

negatives: Have to walk through the casino to access lobby, tram & restaurants
Walls are thin, can hear neighbors & people in the hall.
No bottled water offered (even with M gold status).
While the room has a coffee maker, the coffee cups & sugars were extra. Thankfully we travel to Vegas with our own travel kettle, coffee cups, teas & sweeteners.
The ice machine on our floor was not working the two days were there. We had to go up to the 59th floor to get ice.
I asked for an additional bathroom towel set and was told that the hotel was short on towels.
The hotel did not have a texting feature. Anytime we had questions, we had to join the line at the front desk to speak to someone.
positives: Large lobby with ample seating.
Spacious room with double vanity, shower, and tub.
Close to Allegiant Arena (we walked over to attend a Raider game).
Easy access to Michelob Arena (located inside the hotel).
The front desk agent was polite & provide ample information about the hotel.

When I checked in via the app I was assigned room 7121. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were upgraded to a Stay Well 2 Queen (room 56118). The front desk agent notified us that they wanted to confirm we were okay with the two queens as we had booked a king room prior to assigning the higher floor room.
Prior to checkout, I had questions about my bill and while the front desk agent was unable to provide clear information, their supervisor was professional and answered my questions in depth.
Spacious gym with lots of equipment.

The hotel has two elevators to access rooms. The main elevator for the lower floors always had a line, while the elevator (floors 56 to 62) to access our room on the Stay Well floor was never busy. Also, the hotel renumbered the floors after the 2017 shooting, floors 31 - 34 are now floors 56 to 59.
room: Stay Well Resort Two Queen | Room 56118
title: Mandalay Bay Resort & Casino Hotel Review

children.text: After our two nights at the
Crockfords Las Vegas

, we booked a three-night weekend stay at Mandalay Bay to be close to Allegiant Stadium for the Raiders game. As an M Life Rewards member, benefits are waived resort fee, however no bottle of water. I would stay here again if prices were less than $100 per night when attending events at Allegiant Stadium due to walkability ease. If prices exceed $200 per night, I would rather stay at the Four Seasons (top floors) for a better overall Vegas experience.
After one night at the
Manchester Grand Hyatt San Diego
, we walked the 0.9 miles to the Andaz San Deigo, a 159-room boutique hotel located in Gaslamp Quarter.

We used a Hyatt Free Night to book a standard Queen room & were not provided a Globalist upgrade at check-in. Thomas at the front desk checked us in & provided us with a (plastic) glass of wine & beer. As a King room was not available when I made the reservation, I asked Thomas if a King room was available at check-in. He said to call down to the front desk in 90 minutes & check. (When I called down, they said no King rooms were available).

We took the elevator up to the 5th floor to our room for the night, #507. While were appreciated having a room far from the elevator, the room did not have good views. Also noticed earplugs in the room, which was a bit concerning, however, outside noise was not an issue & I got a great night's sleep.

After placing our bags in the built-in closet, we took photos & recorded room tour videos. After we decided to make a cup of coffee with the in-room Keurig & upon opening noticed the machine had not been cleaned since it was placed in the room. So before using, we did a deep clean with some Lysol wipes & did a few hot water rinses.

negatives: The room faced the Salvation Army & there was trash & homeless people on the street.
The Keurig had not been cleaned in a while: we did a full wipe down & several hot water rinses.
We noticed earplugs in the room, noting there may be some street noise.
positives: While the room is small, the space is functional & cozy.
Comfy bed with firm pillows. We got a great night's sleep on the Queen bed.
Delicious breakfast a the Rooftop at STK.
title: Andaz San Diego Review

children.text: Used a Hyatt Free Night to stay at the Andaz San Diego which is a nice hotel in San Diego's Gaslamp Quarter. While the queen room was small, it was quite functional & used the space well. Would definitely stay here again for the comfy bed & delicious breakfasts.

"Enjoy being steps away from lower Manhattan’s waterfront, retail shops, exciting restaurant scene, ferry and subway hubs, and more at Hyatt Centric Wall Street New York. Here is where you can easily explore the best of New York City then return to a spacious, lofty, sun-filled room." -
Hyatt

negatives: The room did not have a luggage rack.
There was no keycard needed to access the elevator.
Some time out of the ordinary for the Hyatt brand: there was no contact via text feature. On Saturday night we rang the front desk several times to nonresponse.
The wifi timed out each day, needed to log in on all devices each day. Would have preferred an option to stay logged in for the entirety of our stay.
The walls were thin, we could hear hallway noise, including a dog parking in a neighboring room.
The hotel did not have an ice machine. Requested in person from the front desk twice and went to the bar once to request it.
Minimal storage space, there were only two drawers under the living room TV.
There was a weird reddish stain on the ceiling in the bathroom that we could not identify.
Hotel breakfast options were limited, we were able to try everything over the course of two days & picked our favorites for the remaining 2 days.
positives: Ample seating in the lobby.
Attentive and personable staff: everyone we encountered was pleasant.
Quiet hotel in the financial district.
Close to the Wall Street subway station.
Received a complimentary upgrade to a spacious corner Centric Suite with several large windows & high ceilings.
The hotel has 6 elevators and there was rarely a wait during our 4 night stay.
Large shower/tub combination with a deep soaker tub.
The gym was a decent size however it was rather warm. The door was propped open and there were several portable fans plugged in.
Electronic blackout curtains have partial open capability.
The room had ample power outlets in convenient locations.
There were two large TVs in the room. The one near the bed allowed easier access to the HDMI port.
The room had a fridge for personal items (albeit missing a shelf).
Requested coffee machine & it was delivered quickly to the room.
The hotel offered free coffee on the "R" level during breakfast hours.
Globalist breakfast credit was $90 each day, nonetheless the full amount each day (up to $100) was comped.
title: Hyatt Centric Wall Street New York Review

children.text: Originally booked at the Conrad NY Downtown hotel, we changed to the Hyatt Centric Wall Street as it was priced significantly cheaper and allowed us to add 4 nights towards 2023's globalist status. Located in the quiet financial district, close to restaurants and the subway, it was a great base for 4 nights in NY. While we enjoyed our stay, there are so many other hotels in NY we would want to visit prior to returning.

Booked Monday, August 22 for an August 26th stay with a rate of $198/night for a King Bed Deluxe. Interestingly, three days before check-in a Centric Premier Suite was added to the list of available rooms. The day before check-in, we received a complimentary upgrade to a 7th Centric Suite (of 17 floors).

negatives: Check-in was short. While the front desk agent was nice, she was not aware of Hyatt Prive (no welcome letter) & did not mention my Globalist status benefits. She also pointed me to the elevator rather than walk me to it & didn't call 10 minutes later to check if everything with the room was ok.
The entrance smelled horrendous. Like they just put down mulch. By the 2nd day the smell has subsided & was minimal.
Text feature is not available on Whatsapp, a small feature that could cater to global audience.
The front entrance does not have a ramp, down the stairs to the front desk, an accessibility concern.
Welcome amenity was 1 bottle of still water & chocolate covered cherries with no note, so unsure who it was from.
The hotel did not send a prewelcome email asking about preferences prior to check-in.
positives: Booked a Park Executive Suite and was upgraded to a Georgetown suite on the 3rd floor.
Bed was very comfortable. Requested 2 additional pillows after check-in.
Large bathroom with double vanity, along with shower/tub combo.
Spacious corner suite with dining table (only 3 chairs), large sectional, 1.5 bathrooms and a separate workstation area. Lots of windows (that could open) which allows for ample natural light.
Globalist breakfast credit was listed as $60 per person. Total for 2 averaged $130 and all but the $5 room service delivery fee was removed.
title: Park Hyatt Washington DC Hotel Review

children.text: Similar to our
last stay

, we booked a 3-night free stay, this time in a Park Executive Suite for $918 plus tax. Upgraded to a large corner Georgetown suite, we had more than enough space for our 3-night stay. The hotel is a good base 0.5 miles from the Foggy Bottom metro & walkable to Dupont circle. There are several hotels in the area yet the area is rather quiet & easy to navigate, would stay again.

"Nestled next to the legendary Beringer Estate Winery, and just a short walk from St. Helena’s vibrant downtown Main Street, Alila Napa Valley is ideally placed to experience the best of California’s most celebrated wine region – from exploring its beautiful countryside to indulging in its epicurean lifestyle" -
Alila Napa Valley

negatives: GPS had an issue finding the entrance, the hotel sign is small and hard to see from the road. We drove past the entrance & GPS took us on a 5-minute turnaround.
There seemed to be confusion regarding what is covered under the $55 resort fee.
There was not any security on the property. At Ventana, you had to use your key card to access the entrance to the property when on foot. Those driving in had to check in with a gate agent.
positives: Spacious room, with a large shower and tub. Separate toilet (with bidet) with a second vanity.
Excellent, attentive, friendly staff. The hotel offers a text option & was very responsive to our inquiries.
Fast, reliable wifi (91 MBPS)
Great location in St. Helena, close to Beringer winery, less than 0.5 miles to downtown.
The bed was comfortable, but the pillows were not as firm as I prefer.
Automated light switches & black-out curtains.
Decent size a gym, with three treadmills, two Peloton bikes, a row machine & free weights.
In-room Nespresso machine & kettle.
The room has a large private balcony with a fire pit and ample seating. Spent ample time in the rocking chairs on the balcony.
Delicious food from on-property Acacia House
Even though I declined housekeeping during app check-in, our room was serviced daily and there was nightly turn-down service.
Quiet resort, offering a unique experience being on the Beringer vineyard.
Awesome views. Our room was in the center of the floor's 5 rooms which allowed for complete vineyard views.
room: King Bed Vineyard View High Floor with Balcony | Room #232
title: Alila Napa Valley Hotel Review

children.text: For our wedding anniversary, we used a free night award and 30,000 points for a two-night stay at Alila Napa Valley, where rates were $1,292 per night.

After staying at Ventana Big Sur, we were excited to visit our 2nd US Alila property. With great staff, great food, great views, and a great location this was definitely a trip to remember. We would love to stay here again!
Tip: The rooms are numbered as such: building, floor number, room. So our room 232 was in building 2, on the third floor.

"Hotel U14 is a Finnish-owned boutique hotel located only a few steps away from the beautiful Esplanadi Park and the Market Square. Hotel offers guests a contemporary hotel with inspiring décor and a cozy ambiance, combined with upscale hotel amenities." -
Marriott

negatives: The hotel gym is small & in the basement. There were 2 treadmills & small section of free weights.
The hotel doors don't have a slow-closer which resulted in constant door slams.
The wiew from the room was into the office building next door. We kept the blinds closed during office hours.
Sauna hours were weird. At check-in was told it was 6 - 10, which I thought was 6 am to 2200, however it is actually 1800 to 2200.
At check-in, the front desk agent wrote the wrong room number on the key cards. When we went to the room (504) the door would not work. I checked the Marriott app the room was listed as 304.
positives: Location: "easy" 10-minute walk from the train station. Note: The sidewalk is cobblestone for some portion & other portions are on an uphill.
Gym has sauna, open for limited hours.
Good assortment at the buffet breakfast, tasty pastries and ample juices.
Very comfortable bed, the best sleep we had during our Europe trip.
Staff was very responsive to message requests. Reached out about emptying the mini bar & they came within 5 minutes.
We liked the overall eclectic hotel vibe, interesting color scheme (red & black) with fun art.
Great price. We booked early & reserved our 3-night stay for €618 under their "Stay Longer on Us with Breakfast" special.
title: Hotel U14, Autograph Collection Hotel Review

children.text: Hotel U14 was our favorite stay during our 2-week Europe trip. With a central location, friendly staff & comfortable room, we cannot wait to return.

"Andaz Singapore aims to spark a sense of discovery of the rich culture and heritage of the city and inspire you to experience it with a fresh perspective. Situated at the crossroads of the Kampong Glam, Little India and Bras Basah Bugis districts, our luxury hotel captures the essence of a traditional shophouse-filled alleyway, recreating the spirit of the surrounding neighbourhoods." -
Andaz Singapore

negatives: Light switches were hard to understand & some rooms don't have their own controls (bedroom closet can only be turned on when all the lights are on)
Bed was on the firm side, wished it was more plush.

Hotel gym is small. More than 4 people in it at a time can feel cramped. They have mats for stretching but there is minimal floor space to be able to use. Hotel gym is open 24 hours and accessible via keycard.
Hotel (infinity) pool is small, with 5 - 7 chairs available. There is a small, separate, wading pool for children.
Hotel is expensive for what it offers.
Residence and hotel mix might cause confusion. Two elevator system can disorient guests.
Suite layout is strange, you have to walk through the bedroom to access the living room.
No locking system doors, notable for the main bathroom which might be a privacy issue for some.
There was no easy way to contact front desk from the app. Would love to see a Whatsapp message option rather than having to call or visit front desk.
positives: Location: central location. 30-minute walk to Gardens by the Bay with a bus stop a block away.
Overall clean room, minor issues with air duct dust.
Great customer service from all, staff went above and beyond for simple requests.
Internet was fast (57.1 down) however there were issues with casting.
HDMI access was easy to use, cord management was appreciated.
Room amenities (including mini bar) was fully stocked and replenished daily.
Electronic shades worked well at keeping out sunlight.
Hotel is clean and quiet. Rarely heard other guests on the same floor.
Extensive breakfast buffet with rotating food items.
Hotel restaurants were good, tried Mr. Stork their rooftop bar which had delicious food along with the Cantonese 5 on 25.
title: Andaz Singapore, by Hyatt hotel review

children.text: We loved the Andaz Singapore's central location and the exceptional service we received from the staff. Our room was clean and quiet, and we appreciated the well-stocked mini-bar and effective electronic shades. However, we found the light switches confusing and the bed a bit too firm for our liking. While the rooftop bar, Mr. Stork, and the Cantonese restaurant, 5 on 25, offered delicious food, the gym and pool felt small and crowded, and we felt the hotel was expensive for what it offered and would look to stay somewhere else on subsequent visits to Singapore.
The Hotel Indigo Harrisburg is located in a commercial area off Interstate 283, this informal hotel is 5 miles from the 1890 Walnut Street Bridge and 6 miles from Harrisburg International Airport.

negatives:
The staff was lackluster. The front desk attendant was short in responses & not attentive. I called prior to arrival to inquire if I would be able to check in early (at noon). The person on the phone said it would not be a problem. When I arrived & stated I wished to check in the front desk person stated rudely "Check-in is at 3 pm". I informed her that I had called in & was told I could check in early. With a sigh & brief typing on the computer, she stated "Oh, looks like your room is ready". 

 Walking through the hallways we were not acknowledged by the staff.
No COVID protocol. Staff was not wearing masks nor did they enforce patrons to. However, the hotel restaurant was closed due to "COVID", which seemed contradictory.
Question regarding the cleanliness of the room due to the two AC units being covered in dust & the dirty Keurig machine.
The outdoor pool was drained, likely closed for the winter season.
As an IHG Platinum member, I received no recognition of status.
The total price of $167.66 seemed expensive for the area. This hotel should be priced around $80 - $100 per night.
positives: Close to Harrisburg Airport (MDT), with a shopping plaza & restaurants across the street.
Executive King Room was spacious & kitchenette was equipped with a cold mini-fridge, microwave, Keurig coffee machine & sink.
title: Hotel Indigo Harrisburg-Hershey Review
