children.text: If I was in the area in the future, I would choose a different hotel. The staff was apathetic & rude, the room while spacious was not clean & the price was too high.
One night was too long of a stay at the Hotel Indigo Harrisburg, PA.

"A magnificently beautiful, newly restored 1800s building in the heart of Vesterbro, Copenhagen. Kindness transcends the entire house and circulates from Grand Joanne into Vesterbro towards passionate, kind people – traveling or just looking for a place to hang out." -
Joanne

negatives: There were misses with small touches in the room: a robe but no slippers, a kettle but no coffee machine. The bathroom has toothbrushes but no wash cloths.
Room does not have a useable fridge. We were able store some items in the fridge behind the front desk.
Two elevator system to get to the room with luggage. The 2nd elevator is small & can only accommodate 1 person with luggage.
Room is expensive and the view is the inner workings of the hotel where staff is taking out trash & laundry.
Water temperate system is weird. The sink faucet only has 1 knob and you have to turn it all the way to the left to get hot water, same for the shower.
The bathroom is small, with a shallow sink resulting in water splashing everywhere.
Bathroom does not have any counter space.
Long hallway in the room is unusable space.
positives: Good location close to Copenhagen Central Station & Tivoli Gardens. There are plenty of shops and restaurants within 5 minutes in any direction.
The gym is large and has lots of equipment, albeit it is in the windowless basement.
Friendly staff that spoke English well.
You can text them via Whatsapp & they respond quickly.
The included breakfast was good with a variety of items during our 2-night stay.

children.text: Skip the breakfast package & grab a hot dog from John's Hot dog deli near the train station.

title: Hotel Grand Joanne Hotel Review

children.text: Hotel Grand Joanne is a good base for exploring Copenhagen close to Copenhagen Central Station & Tivoli Gardens. Our two-night stay was pricey (5.422 DKK) and while the room was spacious, it had a small bathroom & view of hotel's trash. If I stayed here again in the future, I would book the Deluxe room (again) for a lower rate (under 2.000 DKK per night) without the breakfast option as there are many restaurants within walking distance.

"Steps away from destination-worthy dining, Cherry Creek's premier shopping, and outdoor trails, our luxury Denver hotel is your place in the heart of it all. Our sophisticated, well-appointed suites, featuring elegant five-piece marble bathrooms, double closets, and pillow-top mattresses, embody the luxury of JW Marriott. From inspired culinary offerings, inviting shared areas, refined meeting spaces, and Rocky Mountain views, we provide everything you need and nothing that you don’t."
JW Marriott Denver Cherry Creek

negatives: No onsite pool
Due to lobby construction (slated to end Feb 2022), you have to walk through Toro restaurant to get to the temporary 2nd-floor lobby.
positives: Good location in Cherry Creek, close to indoor mall & Whole Foods.
Large gym with plenty of equipment.
Comfortable bed.
Spacious room with large bathroom.
In-room Nespresso machine.
Full-size toiletries, including hand soap.
Great staff, app requests were answered promptly. In-person interactions were friendly.
Valet was top-notch, even with the construction, the attendant communicated effectively & ensure everyone knew where to go.
Open 2nd-floor lounge, with a coffee machine & complimentary snacks.
For New Year’s staff put a bottle of champagne in the room with wine glasses.
Hand sanitizers located in multiple locations on each floor; disposable masks also available.
room: Mountain View King Guest Room | Room 621
title: JW Marriott Denver Cherry Creek Review

children.text: We used two 35k certificates for our two night
#NYE
stay, where rates were upwards of $400/night. With no resort fee, a great location and exceptional staff I would definitely stay here again.
This hotel is ranked 2nd in our JW list
JW Houston Downtown
JW Denver Cherry Creek
JW Vancouver
JW Washington DC
JW Los Angeles
With over 100 locations, 35 in North America, we continue our goal to stay at all the
#JWMarriott
brand.

Hyatt Place Dallas / Arlington is in the heart of Arlington’s Entertainment District, just steps from Six Flags Over Texas, and five minutes to Arlington’s famous AT&T Stadium. Our Dallas hotel makes it easy to check out a baseball game at Globe Life Park or catch a concert at Arlington’s newest attraction, TexasLive! Venue. -
Hyatt Place Dallas/Arlington

negatives: Internet is slow (5 mbps).
Both ice machines (3rd & 5th floor) were inoperable, we asked for ice at the front desk.
Hotel is located in an industrial part of town, behind the interstate and there is not much within walking distance: you will need a car.
Elevator jolts between floors which is concerning.
Keycard not needed to access room floors, a security concern.
Starting to show age & should be refreshed soon.
The wall AC unit is loud & has dust in the vent, a cleanliness issue.
positives: Staff is friendly & a welcome amenity was provided upon check-in.
Close to Six Flags.
The hotel offers complimentary breakfast.
Has an outdoor pool.
room: King High Floor (w/ Sofa Bed) | Room 617
title: Hyatt Place Dallas/Arlington Hotel Review

children.text: Built in 1996 and renovated in 2014, the Hyatt Place Arlington is a good 2-night (max) base for those going to Six Flags or AT&T Stadium. In the future, even with our 2-night stay costing a total of $250, I would stay elsewhere as there is not much food/activities available in the area & the hotel was just okay.

Designed for Social Discoverers, Renaissance Atlanta Airport Gateway Hotel showcases urban sophistication, modern style and first class service. Our Atlanta Airport hotel is located at the Gateway Center Arena, just 2 minutes from Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport via the 24-hour ATL SkyTrain free airport transportation train.  -
Marriott

lounge: yes, paid or member only access
negatives: Walls are thin, you can hear everything in the hallways & we could clearly hear the TV of the person in the connecting room.

We arrived close to midnight & the check-in gentleman, while polite & jovial, was doing the bare minimum. He told us incorrect information about the package we purchased & only went to ask someone else for confirmation after I asked follow up questions. He did not tell us where the gym was, how to access the wifi, or the restaurant hours. It was "welcome & here are your keys".

We were charged $45 for parking however we did not have a car. We surmise the parking check box was left on in our folio during check-in. We alerted the hotel to the error on day 2 and they removed the charges, however on day 3 we were charged $45 again.

We booked a rate with $25 F&B credit. When we checked-in the sole restaurant available for the credit was closed. Even after speaking with several different front desk agents over the course of 3 days about how to use our 1st day credit, we were unable to use.
Being an airport hotel, there were not that many (good) restaurants within walking distance.
The curtains in our room had stains on them & the curtains do not overlap enough to keep out the morning sun. I used a hanger to keep them closed.
View is of the parking lot and there is a train that comes through once a day that is quite loud.
No key card needed to access or move the elevator. The "5" floor button was rubbed off in the one (of two) elevator that seemed to be working.
The innerspring mattress had a sink in it & I had to rotate the mattress to get a good night's sleep. The 4 pillows provided were all  the same & the too soft.
The Marriott Titanium lounge is small & does not open on the weekends.
positives: The hotel was built in 2017 and is still in good condition considering the high transient occupation.
The room is spacious with a desk, a seating area & a small armchair with laptop tray.
Free access to the airport via the nearby sky train.
Premium wifi, once connected, was fast. Was able to have several Zoom meetings in the room with no issues.
SmartTV worked ok, the remote was sluggish & it frequently & randomly would sign out of YouTube.
The room had ample outlets.
The AC unit worked well & the room was cold.
The hotel has ample seating in the lobby. The ambiance is very modern & we liked the overall aesthics.
title: Renaissance Atlanta Airport Gateway Hotel Review

children.text: Renaissance Atlanta airport is a great overnight base if you are going to a Dream WNBA game or need a room close to the airport.

Park Hyatt New York is a luxury 5-star hotel in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, located directly across from Carnegie Hall and one block from Central Park. Spacious guest rooms and suites offer floor-to-ceiling views of the city and spa-like amenities. While in NYC, find serenity at Spa Nalai, take a dip in our hotel pool, explore our curated art collection or host an event in one of our unforgettable venues. -
Hyatt

negatives: The Living Room (main dining) seemed overwhelmed at 8am on a Thursday.
The room walls are thin. We could easily hear people walking outside
positives: Comfortable King-size bed, firm mattress with minimal partner motion transfer.
Great location near major attractions and Central Park
Attentive, courteous personable staff (not too stuffy).
Large gym with sauna & locker rooms.
The hotel has a small indoor pool with great views.
title: Park Hyatt NYC Hotel Review

children.text: This is a great hotel if you want to be close to Times Square.  You have access to a lot of stores, restaurants, and parks. With a great location near Central Park, along with personable staff and modern rooms, we will stay here (on points) again when in New York.

Stay in the heart of downtown near all the excitement that makes Miami a global destination. The city’s best dining, nightlife, arts and entertainment are steps away from your unobstructed waterfront views.
Here

negatives: Small (width-wise) wrap around balcony with no seating available.
Two of the three bedrooms do not come with a TV.
Small drive-way, have to park on the street for access to hotel.
$50 parking per night (in & out allowed).

$45 daily amenity fee which includes: Fitness/Yoga classes, in-room Wi-Fi connection, local and 1-800 phone calls, 24-hour Concierge and Front Desk services, two refillable PATH water bottles, and two complimentary drinks upon arrival.
The room only had 3 robes (1 per bedroom) rather than per person. We requested 3 more robes & they were brought up.
Text communication was inconsistent. Sometimes they would answer immediately, other times it took several hours.
The couch in the unit was not large enough to accommodate our party of 6. Some folks sat on the floor.
The kitchen table came with 5 chairs. We asked for another chair to accommodate our party of 6 & were told they were unable to add furniture to our room.
positives: Great location in downtown Miami. Close to Bayside, Port of Miami & Kaseya Center. Great post-cruise location as well as easy walk to after a Miami Heat game.
Apartment style full service hotel with up to 3-bedrooms to accomodate 6 people.
Quiet hotel (with sound-proofed windows) with nice views.
Large two-level gym with lots of equipment (treadmill, smith machine, free weights)
Fast wifi (220 mbps). There were two ways to connect (room number & last name or with access code)
A washer & dryer is available in the unit; laundry pods were provided & replenished daily.
Nice wrap-around pool with a large TV showing professional sports games. Staff set up our chairs & brought around towels. We did not order food from the pool restaurant.
title: The Elser Hotel Review

children.text: We were looking for a downtown Miami hotel that could accommodate 6 people. Stumbled upon the Elser & booked directly with their 30% off 4-night promo. At $600/night our 3-bedroom suite was what we needed for our post-cruise family holiday. The hotel, while allowing 6 occupants, missed out on full points by simply ensuring there were enough amenities for all occupants. Overall a good stay & would recommend it for large groups.
'There’s nothing in the world like Las Vegas—and there’s absolutely nothing in Las Vegas like Wynn." -
Encore

negatives: No keycard activated elevator (you tap a keycard stand in front of an attendant before heading to the elevator.)
The large hotel doesn't feel personalized.
$45 resort fee no inclusions (basic wifi included).
The TV was glitchy & would stop working randomly.
No in-room coffee amenities or slippers were provided.
Not enough power outlets for all devices.
Visible dust on the minibar, and desk legs.
The four pillows on the bed were flat.
Our room was near a mechanical element and we heard incessant whirring through the walls during the entirety of our stay.
The ice machine on our floor did not work.
The gym was small for the size of the hotel.

The $100 credit received by booking through a travel agent was only usable at the spa, where treatments started at $150. While other hotels allow this credit to be used at food and beverage establishments in the hotel, Wynn seemed to "offer" a credit they know would go unused.
positives: Large (745 sq ft) spacious room with separate seating area
Large bathroom with dual vanity, shower, soaker tub & bath scale.
Firm, comfortable bed.
In-room Alexa controlled the lights & shades.
Breakfast at Espresso was reasonably priced & tastes great. The staff at Espresso was very nice.
Was provided complimentary 2 pm check-out.

We stood in line for 23 minutes and when we got to the front desk we realized we were in line for the Wynn side, rather than the Encore side. Crystie, the front desk agent, was very helpful & knowledgeable. Rather than send us to the Encore side to check in, she checked us in.
Can check in/check out via the kiosk located in the hotel lobby.
title: Encore at Wynn Review

children.text: Booked a one-night stay in an Encore Resort King (nightly rate of $220 + taxes & fees) through a travel agent (Virtuoso) and got upgraded to Encore Panoramic King (nightly rate $263 + taxes & fees).  Coming from the Four Seasons where I felt taken care of, the Encore at Wynn just feels like another Las Vegas strip hotel that didn't provide more than a spacious room with a view.
Explore a host of coastal luxury during your stay at The Seabird. Treat yourself to an indulgent treatment at Sunny's Spa & Beauty Lounge or rejuvenate with seasonal wellness activities.  -
The Seabird

negatives: Bed was not preferred comfort. Felt like cheap spring mattress with thin sheets. Made lots of noise when getting in & out of the bed.
Wished the windows were one way view, can look into (& vice versa) of Mission Pacific patrons' room.
Can hear street noise from 5th floor room.
Weird ticking sound coming from in room clock, which did not stop after it was unplugged.
Flashing light from smoke detector was bright during the night.
Curtains were not automatic.
Outdoor furniture was limited to two chairs & a small table for the large balcony. Wished a lounger was also provided.
Breakfast service at Piper was deshelved. The staff seemed overwhelmed and confused about roles & responsibilities.
positives: Chromecast functionality was easy to use, no issues streaming content.
Booked a King Bed Cityscape View Deluxe, used SUA to upgrade to Grand Ocean Suite. Day of check in inquired about availability & was upgraded to an Grand Ocean Suite with Oceanfront.
Beach themed spacious room.
Good location near beach & Amtrak station. Quick walk after taking the Pacific surfliner.
Large full bathroom with double vanity, walk-in shower with soaking tub.
Provided robes & slippers were very soft & comfortable. Requested blanket, razor, toothbrush & toothpaste via Hyatt app, which were promptly delivered.
Lots of complimentary activities: signed up for Thursday rooftop yoga.
Amazing corner room with wrap-around balcony with million dollar ocean views.
room: Grand Ocean Suite with Oceanfront | Room 501

children.text: I﻿f possible, upgrade to an oceanfront room for unobstructed sea views.

title: The Seabird Hotel Review

children.text: After seeing the Seabird while on the Pacific Surfliner to LA a few years ago, I was excited to visit and check out the city of Oceanside.

G﻿reat hotel for a relaxing beach getaway with tons of shops & local restaurants to try.   We booked a King deluxe room for $359 per night (plus taxes & fees) and used a suite upgrade for the Grand Ocean Suite. Getting a complimentary upgrade to the Grand Ocean Suite Oceanfront, priced at $1,200 per night during our stay, was a treat.
﻿Highly recommend the Seabird for a quick long weekend stay.

"In the CityCenter complex and a block from the Strip, this upscale, gaming-free all-suite hotel is connected via an outdoor walkway to Aria Las Vegas. Upscale suites have free Wi-Fi and flat-screen TVs, plus soaking tubs, kitchenettes, and living and dining areas. Upgraded suites add full kitchens, washers/dryers, and/or additional bedrooms and bathrooms. Some have views of the Strip or the Bellagio Hotel fountain". -
Vdara Hotel & Spa

negatives: Gym was small & the hours were limited (8am - 5pm).
The pool was closed and we were instructed to use the Aria pool. The walk between the hotels was 50% uncovered (unless you walked through the casino) & took around 5 minutes.

$45 daily resort fee "includes" wired and wireless internet, in-room local and toll-free telephone calls, access to 2,000 electronic newspapers, and airline boarding pass printing in the business center.

Note: As MGM Gold this is waived at all MGM properties.
The hotel does not have a "restaurant". The lobby Starbucks had limited hours, and the 24-hour Market Cafe didn't have an extensive menu. Most days we ate off-strip or at a restaurant in Aria.
The in-room tablet did not allow for pre-ordering breakfast the night before. You had to order during business hours.

Valet parking is $30/day Monday - Thursday and $35/day Friday through Sunday.

Note: Valet parking is complimentary for MGM Gold members.

MGM Rewards changed on February 1st. Our Feb 8th stay was met with confusion from staff regarding the perks (_free parking, waived resort fee,$100 credit, complimentary upgrade_).

Note: I emailed customer service on day 3 of our stay & Meghan contacted me to provide a resolution.
positives: Wifi was great (52 Mbps), and there were no issues with Zoom meetings.
Suites are equipped with a stacked washer & dryer, along with an electric stovetop, dishwasher, microwave, full fridge & freezer.
Complimentary laundry detergent and dryer sheets were available by contacting housekeeping.
Staff adhered to and enforced the indoor mask mandate.
There were hand sanitizer and mask stations throughout the hotel.
The valet was efficient, it never took more than 5 minutes to get our car, even during busy times.
Housekeeping was friendly and thorough.
Beautiful unobstructed views, able to see the Bellagio Fountain show along with the Nevada mountains.
Reid, the bellhop who brought our luggage, was nice. He provided tips & tricks about the room (how to control the light shade, who to call to request silverware & etc.)
Non-casino hotel (a negative for some). Patrons can visit the adjacent Aria hotel which has a casino.
Good mid-strip location. Easy access to nearby Cosmopolitan, nearby restaurants, and activities.
title: Vdara One Bedroom Penthouse Suite Hotel Review

children.text: After a 2-night stay in the Vdara Fountain Suite, we were offered a complimentary upgrade to a 56th floor One Bedroom Penthouse Fountain View Suite.

As an MGM Gold member, the $45 daily resort fee and $35 daily valet parking are waived. Booked under an MGM 30% deal and the Vdara Fountain View Suite costs $195 a night (total), which is pricey for a non-weekend stay in Vegas. For our dates, the Penthouse Fountain View Suite was listed for $349/night (plus taxes and fees).
If you are looking for a central Strip, non-casino hotel and you don't have a car, this is an option.
For almost $200/night, I would rather stay at the
Four Seasons Las Vegas
, another non-casino hotel located on the Strip, for better consistent service & amenities.

"A stunning fusion of modern design with stylish oriental flair, Mandarin Oriental, New York features elegant guestrooms and suites—all with breathtaking views of Manhattan and Five-Star hospitality." -
Mandarin Oriental

negatives: Not a fan of the yellow decor, the carpet was thick & made it hard to maneuver roller luggage.
No electronic controls for curtains and lights.
The bed had a spring mattress that had a high partner movement transfer which made it difficult to get a good night's sleep.
The curtains in the room don't keep out the sunshine that well.
The outlet is only located on one side of the bed.
The room had only one pair of slippers in them, so I had to request 2nd pair.
Limited in-room dining menu, for breakfast and dinner.
The small gym was not 24 hours, you needed to ask the front desk for access after 6 pm.
positives: The 50th-floor room had great views of the Hudson River.
Keycard is needed to activate the elevator.
Spacious bathroom with dual vanity, water closet, shower, and soaker tub.
Great location near Central Park West and Columbus Circle train station.
There was a yoga mat provided in the room.
Daily housekeeping and turn-down service.
Was able to get a 1 pm checkout (after some back and forth).
The room had robes and a Breville Nespresso machine.
title: Mandarin Oriental, New York Review

children.text: After our two nights at the
Park Hyatt New York
, we spent three nights at the Mandarin Oriental New York. After our first
MO stay in Miami

, we were excited about our stay in New York.  The MO NY has a great location, and great staff however a small room with non-blackout curtains, an uncomfortable bed at this price point, we would not stay here again.
Booked a “one more night” promo, which was no longer available closer to the check-in date; where the best available rate for the Hudson River Room was $1,495 per night.
The hotel opened in 2003 with 244 rooms across floors 35 - 54 of the Deutsche Bank Center.

Grand Hyatt San Francisco welcomes you with a sophisticated elegance and refined modern style. Located in the heart of the city at Union Square, immerse yourself in the premier shopping, world-class dining, and nightlife of downtown San Francisco. Then retreat to your room where you can unwind and enjoy the spectacular views of the city by the bay -
Hyatt

lounge: yes, paid or member only access
negatives: AC unit was weird to figure out. Upon arrival we turned it off & opted to open the sliding glass door. After a few hours, we closed the sliding glass door & turned on the AC but the room was not getting any cooler. We turned the unit down to 65 F before the room started to feel comfortable.
Lounge is open during certain hours, outside of those house it is locked.
The in-room desk chair is too low for the desk provided.
No suite upgrade, although there were suites available for booking.
$35 daily resort fee (waived for Globalist), inclusions are listed here: https://www.hyatt.com/en-US/hotel/california/grand-hyatt-san-francisco/sfous/policies. Spoiler: nothing of value.
Elevators did not require a key card to access the rooms, a security issue.
positives: Good location close to Market Street. Quick 5 minute walk to Powell station with access to Muni.
Grand Lounge staff was very personable & kept lounge stocked & clean.
Painless check-in, was able to get into room around 9 am.
Nice view of the Bay.
Wifi was easy to use, although it was not password protected. Was able to participate in Zoom calls with no issues.
TV had streaming functionality, which was quick to set-up.

children.text: Great hotel if you plan to visit the Chase Center
• 13 mins via Bus
• 21 mins via Tram
• 20 mins via Muni (free with an NBA Game ticket)

title: Grand Hyatt San Francisco Hotel Review

children.text: We were looking for a place to stay overnight in San Fran for less than $300. Our normal hotels were almost $500 and after some searching, we stumbled upon the Grand Hyatt San Fran which was priced at $275 (sans taxes).

With a location close to Market & Union, close to several train stations, shops and restaurants, it is a good home base for a few days. While the rooms are not too special, the front desk and Grand Lounge staff is very personable which makes it a great pick. While a good stay, I will test out other hotels in the area before returning to the Grand Hyatt.

Located in the Hacienda Business Park, Hyatt House is a residential-style hotel ideal for extended stay travelers to the San Francisco area. Our hotel features large suites with complimentary breakfast, free parking, and a pool and hot tub for relaxation. Our spacious one and two-bedroom suites are designed to create contemporary experiences with separate living and kitchen areas, and modern work spaces. Engaging social spaces to meet with friends or colleagues, meeting rooms, and a prime location all cater to today’s traveler. -
Hyatt

negatives: Outdated  furniture and fixtures
Thin walls. We could hear our neighbor's dog barking late at night.
Dogs are allowed (if you prefer hotels free of pets )
The hotel grounds can feel a little sketchy at night
positives: Full kitchen equipped with fridge, stove,  pots, pans, microwave, etc.
Dogs are allowed ( for dog owners )
Breakfast is provided
title: Hyatt House Pleasanton Hotel Review

children.text: This is a good hotel as a last option. Nothing fancy about it but you will be ok if you are using it as a place to rest your head and leave all day.
NoMad Las Vegas
combines the grandeur of European casino hotels with the glamour and fun of our new home on The Strip at Park MGM. Book a room. -
Nomad

negatives: $42 daily resort fee that includes nothing: "In-room wireless internet access; unlimited local, domestic long distance (the 50 United States and DC) and toll-free calls; airline boarding pass printing; digital newspaper and magazine downloads through PressReader for duration of reservation; access to Paramount+ with SHOWTIME On Demand via in-room television; and fitness center access for guests 18+. Amenities, such as fitness center access, are subject to availability and guest demand."
TV remote was not working.
Wifi is horrendous, speed & connection drops frequently, evident while listening to a podcast that would stop intermittently. Speed test ranged from 2 mbps to 18 mbps.
positives: The room was ready at 13:30, greatly appreciated the early complimentary check-in.
In the middle of the strip, close to T-Mobile & Allegiant Stadium & many shops & restaurants.
Fast, efficient service. We asked for two extra pillows & a blanket during check-in & they were delivered promptly with a smile.
Great value, the room was listed for $119 per night plus $42 resort fee during a Tuesday check-in after Labor Day.
The room had plenty of amenities including a Nespresso machine, free water (a rarity in Las Vegas), robes, slippers, and a cloth laundry bag.
Keycard needed to access elevators, which is a great for a sense of security.
Overall liked the decor more than the sister property, Park MGM. Nomad is a good luxury option close to strip central at a lower price tag than compared to the Four Seasons or Waldorf Astoria.
title: Nomad Las Vegas Hotel Review

children.text: A Stylish Stay with Connectivity Concerns

The Nomad Las Vegas offers a luxurious experience in a prime location with commendable service and a reasonable price point. The early check-in, prompt room service, and abundance of amenities enhance the overall experience. However, the hefty resort fee with lackluster inclusions, coupled with the unreliable Wi-Fi, detract from the overall value.
Recommendation:

Despite the drawbacks, the Nomad Las Vegas presents a compelling option for those seeking a stylish and convenient stay on the Strip. However, guests should be aware of the resort fee and potential Wi-Fi issues.
After landing at Miami airport at 8 am, from our LAX red-eye, we retrieved our checked luggage, collected our rental car, then headed towards the Hyatt Regency Miami for our one-night stay.

We arrived at the hotel around 9 am & parked the rental off to the side of the large driveway. Upon walking in, I approached the front desk to ask if it was possible to check-in. They pointed to a sign stating it would be $50 for early check-in, to which I asked: "Even for a Hyatt Globalist?". They laughed & stated "No silly let's get you checked in".

After ID & credit card verification I was given keys to room 2016, a double on the 20th floor. They noted that there were no clean King rooms available as they had an event the day before & said to check later that afternoon for a possible room change.

We moved the car from the parking space to valet (complimentary on this booked award stay) & the bellhop helped take the luggage out of the car & into a cart. Then we were off into the elevator up to the 20th floor.

The room was spacious & functional, however, the decor was dark & drab. There was a balcony with views into Brickell, however, the balcony door seemed to have been intentionally altered to not be opened by patrons. The Chromecast-enabled TV was small, yet functional. My first impression was that the room was not the star of this hotel, its downtown Miami location was.

After taking photos & videos of the room, we closed the blinds & went to sleep, still a bit languid from the overnight flight. Upon awakening, we heard a not-so-faint hum coming through the walls. After waiting a few minutes, the sound did not disappear &

The Hyatt Regency Miami is located adjacent to the Miami Convention Center, this polished riverfront hotel is a 6-minute walk from Bayfront Park and 2.3 miles from the Vizcaya Museum & Gardens.

Low-key rooms offer free Wi-Fi, flat-screen TVs, and iPod docks. Club rooms have access to a lounge serving free continental breakfast and afternoon snacks. Suites add separate sitting areas.

negatives: Breakfast service was a hodgepodge & felt maniac. There were two people taking orders, however, they didn't communicate with each other so we had to repeat the order to the second person, noting we already ordered with the first person.
The hotel needs renovations as the furnishings are old. Not a fan of the hotel's bathroom that have shower curtains, and a petri dish for bacteria.
Booked a standard King room and received a [high floor] double.
positives: Good location in downtown Miami, close to shops, restaurants & Whole Foods.
Attentive & responsive front desk & valet staff.
Our first room (2016) had a weird humming noise in the walls, we asked to be moved to a different room & our 2nd room was spotless & humm-free.
The room was spacious, with a fridge & coffee pot, along with a work desk & chair.
title: Hyatt Regency Miami Review

children.text: This hotel is attached to the Miami Convention Center & can get very busy during conventions/events. Our stay was quiet with a few hiccups at breakfast & during checkout. I would stay here again for a few nights, noting the bed comfort was not to my liking & at the price point of 12,000 points for our one-night stay.

After spending one night at the Chicago Athletic Association, we hopped on the 147 bus for a quick 20-minute ride to spend our second Chicago night at the Thompson Hotel. At our stop, we got off the bus & started the 0.3-mile walk to the hotel.
Note

: Each time (of the three times) we navigated to this hotel, we got lost. Our GPS had issues with the area & we ended up walking further than necessary to get back to the hotel. Silver lining: I hit my 10k step goal on both days.
This hotel is in a "posh" part of town: close to the Waldorf Astoria & Ritz Carlton hotels, surrounded by high-end shopping with the likes of Prada, Dior & Gucci.

Upon arrival (around 2 pm) we were greeted by several bellmen, who were the highlight of the stay. We entered the hotel & checked in & were notified that we had been upgraded from a King Room to a King Corner (on the 18th floor).
We hopped in the elevator, stepped off on the 18th floor, took a left & making a beeline for the corner room.

Upon entering the room, we noted it was almost twice the size of the Chicago Athletic, with floor-to-ceiling windows encompassing two walls. If only we had requested a water view room, the views would have been even better,
not diminishing the expansiveness of our view.
The view was so amazing, we neglected to check out the bathroom, which was gigantic with a large soaker tub and a separate shower.

While the Chicago Athletic had double sinks I would definitely trade that for the full soaker tub, any day. (Side note: ran to Target & grabbed some Epsom salt & had two baths during our one-night stay here.)

On the downside, the in-room fridge was locked so basically unusable and not sure what was up with the TV, however the picture was sporadically grainy or frozen. While not a huge deal as we were not in the room to watch TV, still something that should be fixed.
TV Issue
We dropped off our stuff in the room & headed back downstairs to grab a late lunch at the nearby Velvet Taco.
After eating we came back to the room to change before heading back to Grant Park for the 1830 Music Festival (
which was amazing
The hotel did not offer breakfast, as the attached restaurant Nico was only open for dinner. After waking up at 7 am, I ordered pickup from the nearby Wildberry Pancakes & Cafe.

Ventured out in the cool & quiet early morning for the quick 0.5-mile walk to the restaurant (located next to the Ritz Carlton) & was astonished that before 8 am the restaurant was packed, with people standing outside, waiting. On the way back to the room, stopped at the stand located outside the hotel & grabbed coffee, a muffin, and a fruit smoothie to accompany the brisket hash & chicken and biscuits.
With a 4 pm check-out, lounged in the room for the remainder of the day before heading to the airport.

negatives: No available in-room fridge locked wine fridge.
No in-room coffee maker; no coffee is available in the lobby.
TV consistently cut in & out, staticky images: no Chromecast option.
No ice machine available (requested & was given a container of ice)
positives: Great location in the Gold Coast, with tons of high-end shops & restaurants within walking distance. Away from the touristy part of town.
Wonderful staff, especially the doormen who were always chatting with us & helping us find our way.
Great views, definitely try for an odd-numbered room for a lake view.
Large gym with peloton bikes. (Note: view from treadmills was of a parking garage.)
Spacious bathroom with shower & large tub.
Stumbled upon the Secret Stairwell - an art gallery of local artists.
title: Thompson Chicago Hotel Review

children.text: We used a @hyatt free night certificate for this stay. This category 4 hotel requires 15k points (non-peak) and ranged between $250 - $400/night. The great location &  staff made for a wonderful stay & we will definitely visit again.
"Sleep is a necessity. Really good sleep is a luxury." -
Ameswell Hotel

negatives: On our 2nd visit the parking lot was no longer free.
positives: Good location in Silicon Valley, right off the highway.
Great restaurants with reasonable prices and tasty food. Had dinner at the Roger as well as breakfast and coffee at the Flyby.
Large gym with plenty of space & equipment. The gym has a floor to ceiling windows that let in lots of light.
title: The Ameswell Hotel Review

children.text: Set on a cliff overlooking the Pacific Ocean, this high-end resort is a 3-minute walk from South Carlsbad State Beach, 6 miles from LEGOLAND California, and a mile from Interstate 5. -
Alila Marea Encintas Hotel

negatives: Found an old contact behind the pillows on the sofa.
There is little privacy when you are on the room balcony, as there is a walking path underneath that is used frequently.
$55 daily resort fee (waived for Globalist on award stays). Check out inclusions here: https://www.hyatt.com/en-US/hotel/california/alila-marea-beach-resort-encinitas/sanen/policies
No self-parking available. Valet parking is $60 per night (waived for Globalist on award stays).
There was a wedding happening that we were not informed about prior to arrival.
positives: Granted early check-in (12 pm) & late check-out (4 pm)
Chromecast functionality on the TV worked well.
Room had a white noise machine
Amazing coastline views from the 3rd floor room.
Comfortable room with large bathroom, ample seating & storage space.
Utilized the E-Bike rentals that were included in the resort fee. Easy to maneuver & valet staff gave good recommendations for exploring the nearby town.
Brunch at Vaga was delicious.
room: King Coastline View with Balcony | Room 331
title: Alila Marea Encintas Hotel Review

children.text: Our stay at this hotel was largely enjoyable, with highlights including the stunning coastline views from our comfortable room, the convenient Chromecast TV feature, and the fun we had exploring the area with the included e-bikes. Brunch at Vaga was also a treat. However, we were disappointed by the lack of balcony privacy, the hefty resort fee, and an unexpected wedding that disrupted the peace. We used a Free Category 1 - 7 Award for a one-night stay. It was the perfect weekend stay after our 7 am flight into Long Beach airport and a guaranteed 4pm late check-out.

"Stay in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, just two blocks from the Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden and a block away from shopping on 5th Avenue. Inside our hotel, every square inch reflects the unmistakable energy of the world’s most dynamic city, from stylish rooms with extra vanities to eclectic dining. Take in views of the Empire State Building from our rooftop terrace while you sip your favorite drink." -
Hyatt

negatives: Keycard is not needed for the elevator which is a safety concern.

The hotel only has 2 elevators, which results in long wait times in the mornings.

[January 2025] One elevator was out of service during our stay. There was a note in the lobby which called it an "elevator project". Expect longer wait times during 8 - 10 am and 3 - 5 pm.
Room is small at 195 square feet; hard to navigate with 2 adults and luggage.
We were "upgraded" to a city view room however, our room looked into the buildings across the street.
During the mornings the housekeeping door nearby creaks very loudly when accessed which happened very frequently.

Breakfast service while good intention was slow & the server forgot several items. One party's food came out almost 5 minutes after the first plate was dropped off. After eating here the first day (Globalist benefit) we skipped it as there are ample food places within walking distance.
Very thin walls. I could hear when our next door neighbors sneezed.
$25 daily destination fee with minimal inclusions  (waived for Globalist). https://www.hyatt.com/en-US/hotel/new-york/hyatt-herald-square-new-york/nychh/policies
positives: Good location in Midtown Manhattan, close to everything & anything.
Raymond at the front desk was very jovial & provided a wonderful check-in experience.
TV has chromecast functionality that worked well.
The window could be opened to allow in all the sights & smells of Midtown New York.
Comfortable King-size bed.

Staff at the rooftop bar were personable. Happy hour food and drinks were good.

[January 2025 update] The rooftop bar was closed for the winter season, drinks & $10 bar bites were available in 1st-floor dining area. The coconut shrimp, truffle fries & chicken wings were good & reasonably priced.

$233 average per night rate is cheaper than NYC's $300 rate. For the price & location it is a steal.

[January 2025 update] Paid ~$145 per night during our 4-night stay  which is a great price point for this hotel
title: Hyatt Herald Square New York Hotel Review

children.text: In town for a NY Liberty game we needed a central base. The Hyatt Herald was the cheapest option of the 4 star ratings, and helped me achieve another stay towards Brand Explorer.﻿ Not expecting much, we were surprised by the friendly front desk & rooftop bar staff along with the albeit small, functional & comfortable room. As we plan our return to NY for a Knicks game I am already planning our return stay here.
Safe issue:

Reached out to the front desk who sent up an engineer who after 3 attempts was unable to open it. He left saying he would return however 60 minutes later, nothing. After contacting the front desk, the engineer called back to say they would return in the morning. The next morning after 30 minutes of drilling the safe was opened.

Our downtown Denver boutique hotel welcomes locals and globetrotters alike to indulge in the best the Mile High City offers. Located in the heart of vibrant LoDo — the city’s historic Lower Downtown neighborhood and near the RiNo District, Thompson Denver is an easy walk to historic Union Station, Larimer Square, and the buzzy bars and restaurants of the Dairy Block. Inside our luxury hotel, find sophisticated meeting facilities and event venues, celebrated French cuisine at Chez Maggy, and creative cocktails at our 6th-floor lounge featuring stunning views of the city and mountains beyond. This central Denver hub is a place that’ll keep you coming back for more. -
Hyatt

negatives: $21.06 destination fee inclusions listed here: https://www.hyatt.com/thompson-hotels/denth-thompson-denver/policies
The walls/windows are thin: loud vehicle sounds & music from the street (we were on the fourth floor).
The safe would not reopen after placing items in it & locking. (See more details below)
The pillows provided were too soft, prefer firmer, memory foam pillows.
The room did not have automatic blinds. The metal rods would swing & hit each other making a loud "tink" sound.
Well appointed gym is located in a dark, windowless basement.
There was no welcome amenity provided.
positives: We booked a 1 King Bed and were upgraded to an Executive Suite.
The hotel emailed a concierge survey 48 hours before arrival; a nice way to set preferences for the stay.
We were able to get an 12 pm early check-in, after requesting a 9 am check-in.
Room had a nice in-room clothes steamer.
TV had Chromecast functionality that was easy to setup. However, the TV output quality was 720p.
Good location near Union station & plenty of restaurants and shops.
Pleasant front desk staff; prompt response to text requests.
Spacious size bathroom with large shower.
French toast breakfast at Chez Maggy was delicious.

children.text: If you are unable to Log in to the WIFI -
1. Open a browser window
2. Type "abc.com"
This should trigger the login screen

title: Thompson Denver Hotel Review

children.text: N﻿eeded a LoDo hotel to attend the NBA game. With a personable staff, spacious room & good location near shops & restaurant would definitely return.
Our one-night stay was $339.61 ($271.80 rate plus fees & taxes).

Two days before arrival 1 King Bed was listed for $716. Executive Suite ($916) and Skyline Suite ($966) were also available. The hotel was unavailable the prior night. Peak pricing was in effect as the 1 King Bed was listed for 23k points.

Hyatt House Philadelphia/King Of Prussia is a contemporary hotel located in the heart of King of Prussia, Pennsylvania. The hotel is within walking distance of the King of Prussia Mall, the Valley Forge National Historical Park, and many other popular attractions. Hyatt House Philadelphia/King Of Prussia offers a variety of amenities, including free Wi-Fi, a fitness center, an indoor pool, and a complimentary breakfast buffet. The hotel also has a variety of meeting and event space, making it a great choice for business travelers.

title: Hyatt House Philadelphia/King Of Prussia  Hotel Review

children.text: "The Four Seasons Las Vegas, attached to Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino, is a luxe, art deco style hotel located within 2 miles from both the Bellagio casino and Harry Reid International Airport
(formerly McCarran International Airport)

negatives: Daily $45 resort fee. Booked a 3rd-night free stay and still was charged the $45 resort fee on the "free" night.
The pool was closed, could use the adjacent Mandalay Bay pool.
positives: The staff here is exceptional. Every person we encountered went above & beyond even for the simplest requests.
We booked a Strip View studio room & were upgraded to a Strip View One Bedroom Suite, a spacious, well-appointed room for our stay.
Great location on the #lasvegasstrip that is far enough away for a respite from the crowds.
Fast, reliable WIFI (19 mbps)
The @fourseasons app allowed for easy, prompt communication with staff.
In-room @nespresso machine, comfortable robe & slippers.
Delicious food from hotel restaurant Veranda (breakfast & dinner).
Daily housekeeping & turndown service.
Large gym with Peloton bikes, free weights along with a plethora of equipment.
The bed was so comfortable, I truly did not want to get up & leave each morning.
title: Four Seasons Las Vegas Review

children.text: Booked a 3-night stay at the Four Seasons Las Vegas for under $800, which included daily breakfast (
$90 per day
), complimentary upgrade to a suite & a $100 per stay credit (
used towards dinner at Veranda
). First time staying at the Four Seasons brand, which is known for its luxury & service. 5-star stay at a 5-star brand, and will definitely return.

Overlooking the Atlantic Ocean, the Confidante Miami Beach hotel is set in a1940s art deco skyscraper. It's a 2-minute walk from Miami Beach. Chic rooms with a 1950s vibe feature minibars and flat-screen TVs. Suites add sitting areas, living rooms, and/or kitchens with wet bars and fridges. Some quarters also have private balconies and/or ocean views.

negatives: Ambersweet restaurant was closed during our Monday to Wednesday stay. All food ordered was taken to-go.
The hotel charged a 20% service fee on every order. This 20% charge was not taken off for Globalist breakfast orders.
At 350 square feet, the room & bathroom was small. I intentionally booked the King Deluxe to have a sofa & the "upgraded" room did not have a sofa.
Wished the hotel had a more authentic Miami menu, including Peruvian, Cuban, or Venezuelan food.
positives: Great location on Miami Beach with direct access to the beach.
Booked through Hyatt Privé which came with roundtrip transportation from Miami airport. They picked us up from the Hyatt Centric Brickell & dropped us off at Miami airport.
Great staff: from check-in to the bartender and restaurant staff, everyone we encountered was nice & professional.
The hotel has a Museum of Graffiti collection, with an available audio tour, which was nice during a rainy day at the hotel.
Room decor definitely has beachy vibes with carpet & furniture. Outdoor furniture was bright yellow & blue, which simulated the sun & ocean.
Oceanfront views were a show-stopper. Spent most of the time on the balcony on the lounge chairs.
Two pools (albeit next to each other), one for families & one for adults.
room: 1 King Bed Ocean Front with Lounge Deck
title: The Confidante Miami Beach - The Unbound Collection by Hyatt Review

children.text: Booked a King Deluxe for $239 (+ taxes & fees) per night & was upgraded to an Oceanfront with Lounge Deck. I booked this hotel specifically to be close to the beach, to lounge in the Miami sunshine & this hotel was perfect for that type of trip.

After living & working in South Florida for almost 10 years, I have come to tolerate Miami's lackluster customer service & premium proximity prices. I was surprised as the staff was pleasant and the hotel felt well-maintained; I would stay here again.

negatives: An odd number of rooms don't face the runway.
The room service menu lacks simple items.
Barn door bathroom (sans lock).
positives: Attached to airport (quick Airtrain).
Spacious room, comfortable bed.
Spacious bathroom with soaker tub & shower.
Large 1st-floor gym.
title: Grand Hyatt At SFO Hotel Review

children.text: After staying at Hyatt Regency San Fran and San Fran Airport Marriott Waterfront, we spent one night at the newly opened Grand Hyatt San Fran.

They say don't judge a book by its cover, and I judge hotel rooms by their (sometimes, lack of) coffee machine. The Nespresso in this double queen gets high marks, along with the double-walled Bodum glasses.
Redeeming 20k Hyatt points felt astronomical as that's the same redemption needed for one night at the all-inclusive Hyatt Cabo, and 8k more than the nearby Hyatt Regency SFO.
Verdict: well worth the 20k. This is my new go-to SFO hotel.
"Desert sun, Vegas moments" - Las Vegas Hilton at Resorts World

negatives: During check-in, there was no mention of my gold status or elite benefits. Dorothy, the front desk attendant, was very new and kept going to the back office for answers to the questions I had.
I checked in 24 hours before and requested a digital key that never came. After check-in when I requested a digital key, the Hilton app kept giving an error message.
No in-room coffee machine. No complimentary coffee was provided.
The clock in our room was one hour behind (easily fixed). Does that mean the clock has been wrong since March 13, 2022, when Daylights Saving began?
The gym is open from 5am to 8pm. Which we found out when we tried to access at 11pm. Such a weird time for this massive resort located in a city full of nightlife.

There was no text feature (either with the hotel directly or via the Hilton app). We had to join the check-in line for simple inquiries, which sometimes resulted in a 15-minute wait to speak to someone.

The daily $45 resort fee includes (spoiler, nothing):
"Guest internet access; smart TV casting ability; 10% off spa or fitness retail; 5% off spa or fitness treatments; 5% off cabana experience; 5% off 2 pool chair experience; unlimited local and toll-free calls."
The hotel does not provide a complimentary airport shuttle service (which could be included in the daily $45 resort fee).

The Hilton app had limited functionality, unable to see bill charges. (You can view your room charges with the in-room television,  however, noted the charges listed were all coded as "sales tax" which was incorrect).
YouTube TV Chromecast functionality was not working (known YouTube API issue).
Vending machine on the floor was completely sold out. Mentioned to Dorothy at the front desk who stated it was through a third party & they did not have a way to refill it.
No robes or slippers were provided. I did not remember to ask when I went back down to the front desk.
The bathroom door only opened halfway.
positives: No line during check-in.
The bathroom was a nice size with nice amenities (hand soap smelled good).
The high floor, corner room was quiet.
AC worked well. Upon entering the room it was quite warm & we set it to 69 and the room was cool within 30 minutes.

The room key is programmed for your floor (both a pro and con). For security, if your room is on the 58th floor, you can only access the 58th floor with your key card. However, if you have family on multiple floors, you cannot access their floors that differ from yours.
Full-sized toiletries in the bathroom.
In-room fridge, separate from minibar to store personal food.
Both nightstands had multiple power outlets including USB charging capabilities.
The city view was nice from the 58th floor.
At 7 am on the day of check-out, I spoke with John at the front desk about a late check-out. Was given a 12 pm complimentary check-out and was informed that a 1 pm would cost $50.
title: Las Vegas Hilton at Resorts World Review

children.text: Booked a one-night stay in a King Deluxe City View at Las Vegas Hilton at Resorts World directly with Hilton for $233.56 ($161 room charge + $45 resort fee + $27.56 taxes). According to the rate, this rate was a 'resort exclusive' for 20% in savings.
Arriving after 11 pm, we stayed here as it would be easier to transfer to Conrad for our two-night stay, the following day.
In the future, for $200/night, I would rather stay at the Conrad, which has bigger standard rooms and more in-room amenities.

"Discover Hotel Kabuki in San Francisco’s Japantown—just steps from the famed Fillmore Auditorium. Blending modern Asian and Western influences, Hotel Kabuki offers a unique neighborhood experience in the heart of San Francisco. This boutique hotel features hip interiors and a spectacular lofted-beam lobby that radiates a lounge vibe. The hotel’s highly acclaimed Nari restaurant presents a California-inspired Thai dining experience. From serene guest rooms and a well-equipped gym to event spaces that flex to accommodate any group, the Hotel Kabuki is the perfect home base for your San Francisco experience." -
Hotel Kabuki
website

negatives: TV streaming (YouTube) randomly signed out and the two remotes were sluggish.
Elevators are not keycard operated. (Note our room was on the lobby floor (2nd) and we did not need to use the elevator.)
No hotel restaurant: the attached restaurant (Nari) is not affiliated with the hotel.
positives: Great location in Japantown, near plenty of shops and restaurants as well as close to several bus stops.
Large comfortable suite (over 500 sq. ft) with pleasant garden views, two TVs, a work desk, sofa, and a mini fridge.
Friendly staff, from check-in to breakfast attendants.
24-hour large gym with plenty of equipment including a punching bag, TRX, Peloton bike, rower, and free weights. The gym also has a beautiful garden.
The hotel has a coffee machine in the lobby (long line during breakfast) offering complimentary specialty drinks found in larger hotel lounges.
Large bathroom with great water pressure.
Plush robes and slippers were provided.
The breakfast buffet ($30 per person) included in our room rate was tasty. It included pastries, oatmeal, yogurt parfait, and eggs, along with breakfast meat and carbs (that rotated during our stay).
The hotel lobby was inviting with plenty of seating and rows of bookshelves filled with books. It was easy to space out even though the hotel was sold-out.
title: Hotel Kabuki - JDV by Hyatt Review

children.text: Over the years after visiting San Fran's Japantown several times, staying at the Hotel Kabuki was added to the bucket list.

We booked a three-night stay in a Loft Suite ($334/ per night + taxes) through our travel agent and had a wonderful stay. From the amazing service to the spacious room to the expansive gym I am in love with this property and would go out of my way to stay here again.

Miyako Hotel Hakata is a 5-star hotel located in the heart of Hakata, Japan. The hotel is directly connected to Hakata Station, making it the perfect place to stay for business or leisure travelers. Miyako Hotel Hakata offers spacious and elegant rooms and suites, as well as a variety of amenities, including a natural hot spring spa, a rooftop pool, and a fine dining restaurant. The hotel also has a convenient location, close to many of Hakata's popular attractions, such as the Canal City Hakata shopping mall and the Fukuoka Tower.

negatives: Small buffet
View from the room was top of the school.
positives: Close to the train station
Quiet
Breakfast food was tasty, and had fresh squeezed orange juice.
Nespresso in the room
title: Miyako Hotel Hakata, Japan

children.text: Park Hyatt Jakarta features 220 rooms as well as luxury hotel dining and entertainment options. Our hotel will be a haven for intimate and stylish events including weddings, corporate functions, and social gatherings.

negatives: Bathroom soaps are generic Hyatt Regency brand wall-mounted pumps. Would have preferred a higher brand for the hotel.
The windows need more soundproofing. You can hear the nearby train throughout the day, along with traffic noise & 4 am prayer.
Bedroom sliding doors don't have locks.
Two elevator system which is not my favorite but is understandable for security purposes.
positives: 5-star service from the moment we arrived. The staff was very friendly & very accommodating.
Used a Hyatt suite upgrade to book a Park Suite Deluxe room, which was going for IDR11,874,050 per night during our May 2023 stay. The room was nicely appointed with ample space and tons of light.
Location (4.5): Across the street from the US Embassy; a 10-minute walk to Monas and the National Museum. Close to restaurants, street food vendors, coffee shops, and coin-operated laundry.
Cleanliness (5): Passed black light test; housekeeping was very thorough.
Hotel Service (5): The gold standard of hotel service. They truly exemplify their #LuxuryisPersonal Brand.
Bed Comfort (5): The bed is on the firmer side and felt quite large for a King size bed. Pillows are also on the firmer side. They offer a pillow menu including body pillows.

Room Amenities (5): Nespresso machine, tea kettle, coffee cups with saucers, and two sizes of glasses. Bathroom amenities included 2 Robes, slippers, combs, brushes, toothbrushes, bath salts & a vanity kit.

Hotel Gym (5): The gym is large with treadmills, free weights, and lots of rep-counting machines along with a workout room. Concierge told us that the hotel offers a personal trainer however we never tried it out. Changing room

Breakfast in the Dining Room was delicious. Offering an extensive variety of local and international cuisine. Each day had different chef specials. As a globalist, I was offered the opportunity to order off the a la carte menu as well as select items from the buffet.
Chromecast functionality was one of the easiest to use, following TV prompts or accessing via QR code or Hyatt app. No issues streaming YouTube content.
Hotel Pool (5): The pool located on the 35th floor has both open & covered chairs. Available staff for ordering from the conservatory menu, note there is a service charge.
Key card activated 2nd elevator. When you tap, it automatically selects your floor.
Loved the bathroom design. Double sinks (facing each other, with a mirror in between), large soaking tub, shower & water closet. Gold-platted fixtures added a touch of luxury & elegance.
Automatic sheer curtain and blinds. Blinds did a great job blocking out the morning sun.
The hotel has plenty of dining options. Breakfast is available in the Dining Room, Lunch at the Conservatory, or at the pool. Dinner at the Dining Room, Conservatory, or Kita on the 37th floor.
title: Park Hyatt Jakarta Hotel Review

children.text: We were excited to stay at Park Hyatt's first and only location in Indonesia. Using 60,000 Hyatt points for our 4-night stay, along with a suite upgrade we enjoyed our Park Suite Deluxe room. We were greeted by name by all of the staff, and over the course of the 4 days, the staff remembered small details about our preferences that were incorporated throughout. Park Hyatt truly encompasses the #LuxuryisPersonal brand & we will definitely stay here again in the future.

negatives: 10-minute walk to Asakusa station.
The theater crowd took over the lounge area.
Japanese western vibe decor (a con for some).
positives: Great location: 3-minute walk to Don Quixote; close to other restaurants & shops.
Attached to a theater, can catch a show.
Clean, comfy room.
Delicious included breakfast.
title: Asakusa Kokono Club Hotel Review ( formally Wired Hotel Asakusa Tokyo Hotel )

children.text: Hipster-ish hotel, in a great location with a good breakfast. The staff was friendly, the room was clean & they even provided yukata. I would definitely stay here again, getting a room with at least a queen or two twins. Our double bed was snug for the two of us.

"Take in water views from within the beautiful and relaxing setting of Story Hotel Studio Malmö, located in the city center and offering joyful, service-minded staff who can help make your stay comfortable." -
Hyatt

negatives: The room lacked storage space to unpack. We spent 3 days living out of my suitcases which were laid open on the bench by the window.

Hotel partners with Nordic Wellness, which is a 5-minute walk. Thee is no information provided by the hotel on the gym policy, which would have been appreciated as there is a specific no outside shoes in the gym policy.
Shower has no door to enclose it, resulting in water splashing all over the floor.
Walls are thin, you can hear the neighbor.
Hotel is the top floors of an office building, which was confusing to navigate prior to check-in.
Building has 2 small elevators, serving all floors, which during the busy workweek might be congested & slow.
Hotel does not require a keycard to access room floors, a safety concern.
positives: Hotel partners with Nordic Wellness which is a large facility with ample equipment for any workout.
Hotel is centrally located, close to the Malmö University, train station and plenty of shops. It is a 10-minute walk to the food hall which has
Free breakfast is offered for all and is very substantial and very tasty.
Room design was minimalist yet functional.
TV is Chromecast-enabled, allowing for additional viewing of cast-able content.
Room has 4 outlets, each with one plug port and 2 USB-ports each. We traveled with UK converters & an (USB-C charger block) and were able to easily charge all of our devices.
title: Story Hotel Studio Malmö Hotel Review

children.text: For the start of our 5-country Europe anniversary trip we booked Story Hotel Studio Malmö as it was 3,500 Hyatt points per night. With a complimentary upgrade to a King Bed Oceanview room, free breakfast for all, nearby train station, this hotel is an ideal base for a few days visiting the Swedish city.

"Above the trendy Brickell Avenue – find the best of both big city adventure and a tropical getaway – arrive at our lifestyle-inspired lobby, savour the fun and flavourful dining experiences, and spend the day with a swim or sway in a hammock within our two-acre sun-kissed sanctuary." -
Four Seasons Miami

negatives: Limited drawer storage space.
Two elevator systems. You need to take one elevator from the ground floor to the lobby on the 7th floor. Then walk through the lobby to access the 2nd set of elevators for access to the rooms.

The elevator key card system seemed not to be enabled. I was able to access our room floor from the lobby without using my keycard, on several occasions over our three-night stay during different times of the day.

Went to the front desk to inquire about room charges and I was not asked for identification; just room number & last name. After which, still without verifying my identity the front desk agent printed out the folio and handed it to me. This is a safety concern.
The bathroom door is similar to a closet door sans a locking system.

After returning home, we realized we had been charged an extra $80 for breakfast on our last day. We contacted Four Seasons on Saturday morning and after being transferred 3 times were told we would have to call back on Monday when the accounting department was in.
positives: Upon entering the hotel, you immediately notice how all the common areas smell great. Not sure if the area is frequently spritzed or if the scent is in the HVAC system. Either way, it was very delightful while not being overpowering.
The corner room was spacious with two double beds and plenty of natural light.
Large bathroom with soaker tub and great water pressure.
In-room amenities included two robes, two slippers, a coffee machine (LavAzza), a tea kettle along with ceramic mugs, and several drinking glasses.
Great engaging staff from the bellman when we arrived to the front desk agent that checked us in, to the housekeepers that brought requested items.
The hotel has an available text feature (also available via the Four Seasons app) allowing for easy communication and requests.
Guests have complimentary access to the massive Equinox facilities.
Upon entering our room we had a packet that included 4 antiseptic wipes, 2 disposable masks, and a hand sanitizer.

Tested out their "Work from the Leisure" program by requesting a monitor, wireless keyboard, and mouse. All were promptly delivered around 10 am the next day. However, the hotel did not have a USB-C to HDMI adapter for my Mac, nor did I carry any dongles.
Large outdoor pool with plenty of seating.
Two luggage racks! Hotels providing one luggage rack per room is a pet peeve of mine. I was very excited to see two in our room (without having to request it).
Prompt in-room dining. Was able to preorder the night before & breakfast was delivered close to the requested time.
Daily morning coffee station located in the lobby with non-dairy milk options.
Further away from Brickell City Centre (a con for some). The hotel is a walk from Downtown Miami (the last stop on the Miami Metromover Brickell Loop is several blocks away).
Ample seating off the lobby area (7th floor).
title: Four Seasons Hotel Miami Review

children.text: After staying at the
Four Seasons Las Vegas
, we were excited for our 2nd Four Seasons experience. Four Seasons is known for its consistent service in its portfolio which was evident between our two stays.

We booked a 3-night stay at Four Seasons Miami for $1,200 ($380/night) under their "One More Night" promotion. Booking through the Four Seasons Preferred Partner program our stay came with daily breakfast ($35 per person), a complimentary upgrade, a welcome treat, and a $100 stay credit.

Located in Brickell Key the Four Seasons Miami is a great base for those wishing to be a bit farther away from the city center. Exemplary service coupled with comfortable facilities provided us with a wondering 3-night stay. We would stay here again when visiting Miami.

The Hyatt Centric Brickell Miami is located in a vibrant area near shops and nightlife, this stylish hotel in a high-rise building is 6 miles from South Beach, 7 miles from Miami Beach, and 9 miles from Miami International Airport.
Sleek rooms with contemporary decor feature free Wi-Fi, flat-screen TVs, and balconies; some offer views of Biscayne Bay. Corner suites add floor-to-ceiling window
s
(via Hyatt)

negatives: The gym was in a windowless space & had limited equipment: three treadmills, one bike & a few free weights, and kettlebells.
COVID protocol was not being followed by staff or patrons. Hand sanitizers throughout the hotel were mainly empty.
There were no robes available in the room.
positives: Great location in Brickell, Miami. A quiet residential neighborhood within walking distance to the shops at Mary Brickell, which include a Publix grocery store.
Fast wifi (55mbps), no issue with Zoom calls.
Spacious suite with comfortable bed, sofa, desk, fridge, coffee pot & balcony. The room had several windows which allowed plenty of light in during the day.
Spacious bathroom, with one sink & large shower; wished the room had a tub.
On property restaurant (Caña Restaurant) had delicious food & drinks.
Great views (albeit in between two residential towers) of Biscayne Bay.
The staff was amazing, especially the staff in the Caña restaurant.
title: Hyatt Centric Brickell Miami Review

children.text: Booked this room via a travel agent, for $249/night, to test out Hyatt Privé, along with my Globalist status. Under Hyatt Privé our stay came with a complimentary upgrade to a King Bed Junior Suite, $100 credit & welcome gift.
With a great location in residential Brickell and a great staff, I would definitely stay here again especially if the rate is under $200/night.
Booked
: King Bed (Golf & Mountain View)
Received:
Oceanfront Suite
Upgrade
(Y/N): Y
Amenities
: $40 daily resort fee (
list here
Note from Hyatt:
The Ocean View Suite is the standard suite used with Suite Upgrade Awards for Hyatt Regency Maui.
The Deluxe Ocean Suite is the premium suite that points can be used to reserve. The Oceanfront would be at a paid rate only.
As a valued
World of Hyatt Globalist
, you’ll enjoy the following enhanced benefits:
• Complimentary Regency Club Access. (Open 630 - 10, 11 - 3, and 5 - 8pm daily)
• Discounted & prioritized valet parking at self-parking rate.
• Happy hour pricing all day at ‘Umalu bar (10am – 11pm).
• $25 discount on full day 2 seater daybed and cabana rentals. Visit the pool desk or dial 3225 to book.
Feel free to utilize the below link to book Two-Seater Day Beds, Kai Lani Tents, Ocean Hales & Ohana Tent:
https://hyattmaui.ipoolside.com/
• 20% discount on general admission to Drums of the Pacific Luau. Only available at
www.drumsofthepacificmaui.com
. Enter promo code: GLOB
•20% discount on retail items located at the Recreations Desk, Visit or Dial ext. 3225.
"Set on 40 acres on Ka’anapali Beach, the completely-reimagined Hyatt Regency Maui Resort and Spa is a getaway in paradise. Enjoy Hawaiian hospitality with stargazing and a traditional nightly
lu'au on-site
, stay loose on the links with oceanfront golf, or unwind at our beachfront spa." -
Hyatt Regency Maui Resort and Spa

negatives: Room wifi is spotty, it kept cutting out despite 93 Mbps speed.
Room Chromecast was spotty & kept dropping while watching YouTube.
The balcony with seating faces the pool, wish it faced the ocean, instead.
The balcony facing the ocean is small & does not have, nor can it accommodate seating.
The sliding door between the living room, bedroom, and bathroom is hard to grab (accessibility issue).
Slow to respond via text feature.
The Regency Club is not accessible 24 hours.
The dryers were not hot enough and had to dry each load twice.
The 2nd-floor room has little privacy due to its location near the walk
positives: Spacious oceanfront suite with ample seating.
The oceanfront suite has plenty of outlets including the living room table, couch & nightstands.
Quiet 2nd-floor corner room in the Napili Tower, with some pool noise midday.
The bathroom has a shower, and tub, however no dual vanity.
In-room Keurig, electric kettle, and an in-room mini-fridge.
Plenty of storage, including luggage under the bed storage.
Well-maintained grounds with beautiful gardens & animals.
Onsite coin laundry, $3.50 for washing (25 minutes) and $3.50 for drying (55 minutes).
Valet parking was listed as reduced pricing however we got free parking during our 5-night stay.
The front desk staff was attentive & friendly. Regency Club staff was phenomenal.

I booked through Hyatt Prive so we had access to both breakfast options in the Regency Club and the Swan. Both had similar foods and beverages. Regency Club had the option to carry food back to our room, which is what we ended up doing most mornings.

The hotel had scheduled an update to their electric system on the 2nd day of our stay, which resulted in power being turned off at 8 am. We went to the Concierge to inquire about our "Tour of the Stars" reservation and were offered a complimentary snorkeling excursion during the power outage.
Massive gym equipped to the gills with machines, free weights, and scented refreshment towels.
Close to Whaler's Village shopping center (15-minute walk), which has an ABC store with cheaper prices than the onsite market.
Even though the Regency Club was not open 24 hours, it offered a variety of foods throughout the day. We were able to get hearty, filling breakfasts and dinners, which saved us money.
title: Hyatt Regency Maui Resort and Spa Hotel Review

children.text: The resort is in a great location and has tons of activities and restaurants which could allow someone to never need to leave during their stay. Great calming stay, would definitely return.

Booked a King Bed (Golf and Mountain View) under Hyatt Prive. A week before check-in an Ocean View Suite became available and I applied an SWU to the reservation. The day prior to check-in we were upgraded to an Oceanfront Suite.
The Flag Shinsaibashi is a 3.5-star hotel located in the heart of Osaka, Japan. The hotel is conveniently located near Shinsaibashi Station, making it easy to access all that Osaka has to offer.
The hotel's rooms are spacious and comfortable and are equipped with all the amenities you need for a relaxing stay. The hotel also has a rooftop terrace with stunning views of the city.

negatives: Room Amenities (3): For a Japanese hotel the amenities were lacking. The bathroom only had toothbrushes & hair brushes. The room did not have a coffee machine (located on the 2nd floor) or a robe. The TV was mounted & we were unable to connect our Chromecast & the hotel did not provide TV casting functionality.
The hotel did not have a gym or a pool.
Windows were not sound-proofed. Our 3rd-floor room was directly over the entrance and we heard people talking throughout the day. I am not sure if a room on a higher floor would be better for noise.
Hot breakfast buffet items were tepid in temperature.
Upon check-in, we were told that the room's fire alarm was sensitive & when we showered we should keep the bathroom doors closed or else the alarm would go off.
Upon check-in, we were also told that to ensure the rooms can be quickly turned for the next guest we should not spray perfume in the room.

The seating near the small library was odd. The chairs felt like they were made for toddlers as they were small & rather close to the ground. There is larger "adult" seating near check-in, however, there is a sign that states books should not be removed from the library.
positives: Location (5): Located near Dotonbori, lots of shops & restaurants.
Cleanliness (4.5): There was a rogue zipper in our room along with a little dust on the shelf when we checked in. The room passed the blacklight test.

Service (4): The staff was responsive and the front desk was always staffed. We did not ask for much during our stay. The coffee machine was out of milk one morning, however, we did not notify any staff about it. When we came back later that day the machine was filled. The staff in the restaurant was courteous & cleared dishes quickly while ensuring the buffet was fully stocked.
Bed Comfort (4): Only two pillows were provided and they were smaller and softer than preferred.
Internet (4.5): Internet speed was 38.9. It worked well and did not have any issues with streaming on cell phones.
Onsite coin laundry. Wash (¥300) took 40 minutes and the dryer (¥100) took 30 minutes. The machines did not have weight limits listed, however, we had no issues washing 3 days' worth of clothes.
The breakfast buffet's cold items were very good.
The Deluxe room has 2 Queen sized beds, which was very comfortable.
AC worked well; the room stayed cold.
The hotel had a little library, which was nice.
title: The Flag Shinsaibashi Hotel Review

children.text: If you are looking for an Osaka hotel catering to tourists from the West, located in the heart of Dotonbori, this is a great place to stay.

Overall I was 'meh' about this hotel. While the room was nice & I appreciated the laundry service, it felt lacking in the Japanese culture. I would be unlikely to stay here again unless I needed to be in the vicinity for a specific reason.
We've stayed twice at Hyatt Regency Lake Tahoe. Once for five (5) nights in February 2021 under their "Work From Hyatt Program" and again for two (2) nights in May 2021.

Under the Work From Home Program, we got 2 connecting rooms, daily breakfast, free parking, and waived resort fees, which are Globalist benefits. The standard King room (1119) was small, however, having the "free" connecting double room (1121) was nice to spread out. Daily breakfast in Sierra Cafe was delicious, we tried many of the dishes, our favorite was the pumpkin pancakes & the fruit plate.
Note: Odd number rooms face the pool, while even numbers face the parking lot. This hotel has 12 floors & we stayed on the 11th floor & had no issues with elevator wait times.
The Family Room (834) was quiet, nice & spacious, located at the end of the 8th-floor hallway with views of the parking lot.

negatives: Room walls are thin, able to hear hallway conversations.
With prices of up to $1k a night for standard rooms, expected better quality in-room amenities.
Daily resort fee of $40 + tax and $26 daily self-parking. Note these fees were waived under the Work From Hyatt program (& for Hyatt Globalist).
positives: Very personable staff: from Austin at check-in, to Laticia in housekeeping to Kristell in the Sierra Cafe.
Great location on Lake Tahoe, beach access across the street.
Great location in Incline Village, tons of nearby restaurants & shops. Austin's across the street was delicious.
Included in the $40 (plus tax) daily resort fee are daily outdoor activities, including hikes & snowshoeing.
Welcome s'mores kit & drink amenities were nice.
Decent-sized gym & heated pool.
title: Hyatt Regency Lake Tahoe Resort, Spa And Casino Review

children.text: Our go-to Incline Village hotel. Great location walking distance to Lake Tahoe & plenty of restaurants. The staff is wonderful & the resort fee provides an outdoor adventure program, which is wonderful.

"Crockfords heralds a new standard for Las Vegas luxury overlooking the world-famous Strip. Talk-of-the-town shopping and nightlife, globally inspired fine dining, star-studded residency performances, and next-generation gaming are steps away." -
Crockfords Las Vegas

negatives: Lack of outlets in the bedroom, most are located next to one nightstand.
Bathroom automatic light is very sensitive, would have liked a way to turn it off the sensor.
Room does not have a desk and there are little spaces to work remotely from the space.

The room bathroom design is not functional. Both the water closet & the shower doors only open in one direction & hit the barrier, loudly. The towel rack is too close to the water closet door, resulting in the door hitting a towel hanging.
After our 2nd night, we went to get breakfast at Suns Out at the same time as the prior day & it was closed. The restaurant said they closed early as it was not busy.
We got a yogurt parfait & fruit cup from Junior's & both had expired (sour smelling) fruit.
They are no longer providing their key keepsake; the front desk says it is due to budget costs.
The Famous Food hall has lost several restaurants with the remaining restaurants reducing menu offerings & increased prices.
positives: Suite is large with double sink, shower & tub; along with a large closet with several drawers. It would be a good room for an extended stay.
Hilton Gold members breakfast credit is available at Sun's Out Bun's Out or Junior's rather than Dawg House, which is an appreciated change.
Adrian at the bar was very personable & made great drinks.

We booked a Superior Room and were upgraded prior to check-in to a One-Bedroom Suite, which was a pleasant surprise. I had planned on inquiring at check-in about the upgrade cost and was very happy to get the room I wanted for free.
room: Strip view One Bedroom Suite - 1 King | Room 64308
title: Crockford West Las Vegas, LXR Hotels & Resorts One Bedroom Review

children.text: Revisiting after our August 2022 stay (
here

), I used my $200 Amex Fine Hotels & Resort towards a 3-night stay totaling $824.43 ($838.56 rate + $185.87 resort fees - $200 Amex credit). We were preemptively upgraded from a Superior Room to a One Bedroom Suite in CrockFord West which was nice. Of the 3 Resorts World hotels, Crockford still remains our favorite, despite the diminishing food options & a $45 resort fee that provides no additional value.

At the heart of Silicon Valley, experience a first-hand connection to the region’s tech legacy, sports, and music venues and discover local adventures blended with artful sophistication. Four Seasons Hotel Silicon Valley brings an inventive approach to creative events, seasonal pop-up experiences, lifestyle facilities, and culinary craftsmanship that culminate in the ultimate urban getaway.
Four Seasons Palo Alto
