negatives: ⁠The bed is very firm, not the usual 'envelope you' mattress that we've come to love at other Four Seasons stays. We had to requested a 2nd mattress pad added prior to our first night as we were both unable to sleep.
The room has old amenities turn dial temperature control, manual shades, and no bathroom night light.
Sliding door bathroom, with a frosted sliding door separating the toilet, maybe a privacy issue for some.
Requested items via app & only some were brought up.
Hotel is in a residential part of town, not close to many tourist friendly activities, especially if you do not have a rental car.
positives: Staff was top-notch, including Emily at check-in.
Booked a superior room & was upgraded to a premier room.
Welcome amenity, fruit basket & sparking water, in the room upon arrival.
⁠In-room Nespresso, kettle, bottled water, robes and slippers.
I had the best massage at the spa, highly recommend.
Nice gym & pool area, which has cabanas.
title: Four Seasons Hotel Silicon Valley at East Palo Alto Review

children.text: Booked a 3rd night free birthday stay at the Four Seasons Palo Alto. While the staff was exceptional & breakfast was phenomenal, I would not return until the property did a renovation & modernized the standard room similar to the May 2024 renovation of their suites.

Hyatt Zilara Rose Hall is set along a sandy beach on the Caribbean Sea, this upmarket all-inclusive, adults-only resort is 10 km from Sangster International Airport and 11 km from Greenwood Great House.

Featuring balconies or terraces, the sophisticated rooms and suites offer free Wi-Fi, flat-screen TVs, and minibars, plus safes, and tea and coffee-making facilities. Some have sitting areas, butler service, and/or direct pool access.

negatives: The beach was well-kept, however, there were rocks & seaweed. Ziva's side of the beach was better for entering the water.
The butler-provided phone stopped working towards the end of our stay & we switched to texting the staff, which ended up being a better, faster way of communicating.
positives: Close to the airport. The hotel has a check-in lounge at MBJ Sangster Airport, with a paid shuttle.
Booked a 1 Bedroom Ocean View Room and was upgraded to 1 Bedroom Ocean Front Butler Suite. Our three butlers were very attentive & made the stay amazing.
Delicious food. Due to COVID, restaurants rotated nightly & over the course of two weeks we were able to try many dishes.
The hotel was at 30% capacity which resulted in little to no wait time for excursions and the pools were not crowded.
room: 1 Bedroom Ocean Front Butler Suite |  Room 1346
title: Hyatt Zilara Rose Hall Review

children.text: Booked a 16-day stay under Hyatt's Work From Hyatt program. This was a great deal that was provided per week: 1 cabana rental, 2 spa sessions, and 3 personal training sessions.
With the upgraded oceanfront room we had a large balcony that had amazing views.
The staff was attentive, super personable & great to be around.
Would
highly recommend
a stay at this all-inclusive resort.

"Crockfords heralds a new standard for Las Vegas luxury overlooking the world-famous Strip. Talk-of-the-town shopping and nightlife, globally inspired fine dining, star-studded residency performances, and next-generation gaming are steps away." -
Crockfords Las Vegas

negatives: The large lobby has plenty of seating however no available outlets. Wifi in the lobby was 10 Mbps.
There were only two agents checking people in during the two hours we were in the lobby waiting for our room. Note: At 3 pm there were 4 front desk agents checking people in.
No lobby partitions for lines, which caused a random cluster of people, unsure of the line order to speak with the front desk.
TV streaming functionality would randomly drop the connection & show what was on live TV rather than what was streaming.
The bathroom door swings in, infringing on the already small water closet.
The bathroom does not have a rain shower. The showerhead in the bathroom looked old in comparison to the newer handheld component.
Unlike other hotels, the automatic shade cannot be opened partially. Click once to open, clicking while it is opening triggers it to close. I was unable to find a way to open the blinds partially.

As a Hilton Honors member, the breakfast credit could only be used at Dawg House which was a horrendous experience. First, after we ordered we were told it would be a 45-minute wait. Second, our food was extremely salty. Definitely recommend folks skip the Dawg House.
The rideshare pickup is a 10-minute outdoor walk from the Conrad lobby. Other hotels, like Mandalay Bay, have closer rideshare locations.

Same Resorts World cons across the 3 hotels:
• The gym is open from 5am to 8pm. Which we found out when we tried to access at 11pm. Such a weird time for this massive resort located in a city full of nightlife.
• There was no text feature (either with the hotel directly or via the Hilton app). We had to join the check-in line for simple inquiries, which sometimes resulted in a 15-minute wait to speak to someone.
• The daily $45 resort fee includes (spoiler, nothing): "Guest internet access; smart TV casting ability; 10% off spa or fitness retail; 5% off spa or fitness treatments; 5% off cabana experience; 5% off 2 pool chair experience; unlimited local and toll-free calls."
• The hotel does not provide a complimentary airport shuttle service (which could be included in the daily $45 resort fee).

After checking out I noticed I was charged twice by Resorts World. When I was checking in I noted to the front desk agent that I was charged twice after our Conrad stay. He noted that they would be vigilant to ensure that did not happen at Crockfords, yet it did.
positives: Large lobby with ample seating.
Booked a standard strip view room. During app check-in, I selected a corner room that ended up having high ceilings & a tub. Nice view of the strip (64th floor).
TV has streaming functionality, with a JBL stereo system in the room.
In-room Theragun was a nice touch albeit random as the hotel is not fitness-focused. Other amenities included comfortable robes and slippers and an In-room Nespresso machine, a rarity in Vegas.
Automatic blinds and blackout curtains.
The room has a mini bar along with a fridge to store personal items.
Ample storage space, there is plenty of room to store clothes for a 5 - 7 night stay.
I liked the neutral color palette of the room, which was muted compared to the Hilton’s blue and Conrad’s red tones.
Bathroom amenities included two dental kits and a manicure kit which included a mini nail clip, tweezers, and an emery board.
The ice machine is located to the right of the elevator.
Quiet floor, we did not hear neighbors from the room during our sold-out. stay,
The hotel is generous with bottled water. Each time we passed by the front desk we would ask for 2 and they happily provided them, no questions asked.

Housekeeping was courteous and fast. They stopped by at 9 am to ask about cleaning the room to which we requested they return at 2 pm. At 2 pm three attendants arrived, one in the bathroom & two in the bedroom making the bed, vacuuming, clearing trash, and refilling coffee pods and water.
One morning we had breakfast in the Kitchen (three eggs, pancakes & brisket grilled cheese). Fabiola was nice & attentive. The food was presented nicely and tasted great.

title: Crockfords Las Vegas, LXR Hotels & Resorts Review

children.text: Before our stay, I read many reviews filled with disdain for the Crockford Las Vegas. After staying at the Hilton and Conrad I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed our time here.
Booked a two-night weekend stay in a Strip View Superior King Room via Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts for $562.94 which included a 25% nightly rate discount.
After staying at the three Resorts World hotels, for $250/night, I would definitely stay at the Crockford for better service, better amenities, and an overall better Resorts World stay.
Overnight stay at Chicago Athletic Hotel in a King Millennium View room. TL;DR great hotel close to Chicago Bean (or
Cloud
, if you call it that).

Normally we've flown to O'Hare when visiting Chicago; on this trip we flew to Midway and now I see why the locals prefer Midway. In the future, definitely making it a point to fly Midway over O'Hare, whenever possible. The ease of it when compared to the chaos of O'Hare is unmatched.

Upon landing, we walked for about 20 minutes to catch the Orange Line train to the hotel. Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) is running a sale on public transportation tickets until Labor Day 2021, saving us 50% on an all day pass ($5 per person, versus $10).

After a 45 minute train ride, we walked down to the street from the platform & walked one block to the side entrance of the hotel. Upon entering a gentleman pushing a baggage cart welcomed us & ushered us to the stairs to the lobby.

Check-in was fast & easy. I used a Hyatt Free Night Certificate to book this stay & in the app saw we were assigned a room on the 19th floor. Because of my Hyatt Globalist status we were "upgraded" to a King Millennium View Room on the 6th floor. I asked if the 6th floor had good views (
since I was originally assigned a 19th floor room
) and was told the original room on the 19th floor was an interior facing room, with no view.

We took our keys & headed up to the corner room located right off the elevator. I loved the dark tones throughout the hotel: from the black room door to the walnut colors in the elevator, it was definitely a vibe. The King Room was large for its 270 square foot size. The bathroom was spacious with a gorgeous marble double vanity.

We dropped our bags & headed downstairs to grab something to eat from the Shake Shack located on the ground floor. There was a line of around 5 people in front of us, which gave us time to review the menu & make our selections. Note: over the course of the next 24 hours, there was always a line at Shake Shack, sometimes stretching into the "faux" lobby and nearly touching the hotel customer service desk located there o on the ground level.
Our wait for Shake Shack was around 25 minutes
(line, ordering, waiting for food),

which was not too bad. Next time will try the in room dining option to compare wait times. Once our food was ready, we headed back up to the room to eat before heading out to the Art Institute of Chicago across the street.

One thing I loved about this hotel was it's proximity to activities - we were able to walk from the hotel to the Art Institute as well as through Millennium Park to get to Navy Pier. Within walking distance is a Magnolia Bakery, Target along with no shortage of restaurants.

Breakfast was served in the "Drawing Room", located right off the check-in counter. Service was prompt & the food was good. My only complaint was that I ordered over-hard (fried) eggs and was given scrambled eggs. When I started I ordered over-hard eggs, the waiter told me they were over-hard scrambled (
is that even a thing?
). Not wanting to argue any further, I took the food.

As a Globalist, breakfast is complimentary, nonetheless, upon check-out why our bill did not have the breakfast charge listed, my credit card showed the charge. When I brought this up to the Assistant Front Office Manager Christina, she told me the charge would drop off after a few days. Noting that the two are separate and the charge hold is necessary. She went as far as emailing me the next day to confirm the matter was resolved.
Overall this was another great Hyatt stay in a nice hotel in one of our favorite cities.

title: Hyatt Place South Reno Hotel Review

children.text: We found the Hyatt Place South Reno to be a bit of a mixed bag, but leaning towards positive with a few caveats. The location was fantastic for us, with easy access to shopping, dining, and the ski resorts. We also appreciated the affordable "Members Save More" rate and the clean environment throughout the hotel. The free parking was a nice bonus too!

However, we were disappointed that the service was lacking, particularly at the front desk where we encountered a rather disinterested agent. We also weren't given any information about the amenities, and to our surprise, the pool was closed without any prior notice. The Wi-Fi was advertised as high-speed, but we found it to be quite glitchy. The gym was uncomfortably hot, and we had some concerns about security with the elevator access.

Ultimately, we think it depends on what you're looking for in a hotel. If location and value are your top priorities, and you're willing to overlook some shortcomings in service and amenities, then it could be a decent choice. But if you're hoping for a seamless and well-rounded experience with attentive service and fully functional amenities, you might want to consider other options.

children.text: The Hyatt Regency Seattle offers a compelling experience with its prime location, excellent service, and comfortable amenities. Shiba Park Hotel offers a variety of amenities and services to make guests' stay as enjoyable as possible. The hotel has a rooftop pool with stunning views of the city, a fitness center, and a spa. There are also several restaurants on-site, including a Japanese restaurant, a Western restaurant, and a cafe.

The hotel's rooms and suites are spacious and comfortable and are equipped with all the amenities guests need for a relaxing stay. The hotel also offers a variety of services, such as room service, laundry service, and dry cleaning.

Shiba Park Hotel is the perfect place to stay for both business and leisure travelers. The hotel is conveniently located near many of Tokyo's top attractions and offers a variety of amenities and services to make guests' stay as enjoyable as possible.

The Hilton Durham near Duke University offers all the amenities needed for a pleasant stay, including a seasonal outdoor pool, free wireless internet access, and a 24-hour fitness center. Guests will also enjoy in-room flat-screen TVs and MP3-compatible radios. -
Booking.com

lounge: yes, paid or member only access
title: Hilton Durham near Duke University Hotel Review

children.text: "Park Hyatt New York is a luxury five-star hotel in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, located directly across from Carnegie Hall and one block from Central Park. Spacious guest rooms and suites offer floor-to-ceiling views of the city and spa-like amenities. Find serenity at Spa Nalai, explore our curated art collection, or host an event in one of our unforgettable venues." -
Park Hyatt New York

negatives: Wifi speed slow - unable to get on premium wifi.
Two elevator systems - one to the lobby and the other to the guest rooms.
Chromecast was not working in the provided panel under the TV.
The living room TV did not swivel, which prevented viewing from any location other than directly in front.
Expensive dining options.
The room did not have USB charging and there were limited available outlets in the “living room”.
Our 10th (of 25) floor room looked into the Carnegie Hall offices across the street.
positives: Comfortable King size bed, firm mattress with minimal partner motion transfer.
Attentive, courteous personable staff (not too stuffy).
Spacious room with minimal functional decor that hid clutter. Appreciated the hardwood floors where the bed was on a large rug.
Spacious bathroom with dual vanity, water closet, soaking tub & separate shower. However, I never figured out how to enable the heated floors.
During check-in was told the Globalist breakfast credit was $90 per day. Day 1 total of $150 and day 2 total of $230 were fully removed.
Large gym with sauna & locker rooms.
The hotel has a small indoor pool with great views.
Fully stocked mini bar which included two sets of drink glasses and coffee cups.
There were fresh flowers in the bathroom.
Daily housekeeping and turn-down service.
The blacklight test came up negative, and the room was very clean (as expected).
Electronic controls of lights and curtains; curtains could be partially opened.
Blackout curtains kept 95% of the sunshine out.
The room had outlets located on both sides of the bed.
US Open art throughout the lobby along with a gallery on the ground floor.
title: Park Hyatt New York Review

children.text: Booked a two-night stay in a King Bed for 50k points before the dynamic pricing went into effect. The week of check-in, the standard King Bed room was listed for $1,325 each night or 35k points. With a great location near Central Park, along with personable staff and modern rooms, we will definitely stay here (on points) again when in New York.

Offering spacious rooms, an onsite restaurant and breakfast bar, and an indoor pool, our hotel in Uncasville is conveniently located near Mohegan Sun Casino, restaurants, and other top attractions. - H
yatt Place Uncasville / Casino Area Hotel

title: Hyatt Place Uncasville / Casino Area Hotel Review

children.text: Excalibur Hotel & Casino is a themed hotel and casino located on the Las Vegas Strip in Paradise, Nevada. The hotel is themed after King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table and features a medieval castle exterior and interior. Excalibur Hotel & Casino offers a variety of amenities, including free Wi-Fi, a fitness center, an indoor pool, and a casino with over 2,500 slot machines and 100 table games. The hotel also has a variety of restaurants, bars, and shops.

negatives: The $35 daily resort fee includes nothing. Per the website: the resort fee includes Property-wide high-speed internet access (public spaces and in-room), unlimited local and toll-free calls, airline boarding pass printing, and fitness center access for guests 18+.
positives: Good location on the strip
title: Excalibur Hotel & Casino Review

children.text: "Located just minutes from Washington Dulles International Airport and a short Metro ride to DC, our Herndon, VA hotel is conveniently located for both business and leisure travelers. Enjoy door-to-door service with our complimentary airport shuttle that runs on a set schedule to IAD. Ensure your travel is relaxing and seamless with our newly-renovated guestrooms, inviting atmosphere, and award-winning staff that is always here to help." -
Hyatt.com

lounge: yes, paid or member only access
negatives: The front desk is small with only two stations. Can see it getting congested during check-out with conference attendees.
Online photos looked more modern than the room in person. While there has been some renovation/updating the bones of the hotel are still old. 3 Elevators are small & slow (8 person max).
While spacious, the room lacks adequate outlets for the space. Many of the outlets are also commandeered for the in-room appliances and light fixtures.

Small bathroom, the toilet is close to bathroom door & shower door. At 5'2", I can stand in front of the toilet & width-wise (arms bent 90 degrees) can touch the wall to the shower door. Length-wise I can touch the back of the door to the wall behind the toilet.
There was one day when they were very slow to respond to text inquiries.
A hotel keycard was never needed for the elevator, which is a safety concern.
The walls are thin. We could hear our connecting room neighbor on the phone.
positives: Nice spacious lobby with ample seating.
Very pleasant staff; breakfast attendant Rosa was phenomenal.
Breakfast on both days was good. Ordered off the menu (rather than the buffett) and the food came out promptly, was a good temperature & tasted good.
Spacious room with two queen beds, sofa bed, and desk.
In-room amenities included a Mr. Coffee machine and a mini fridge.
Comfortable bed with 4 pillows of varying firmness.
Beds have motion-sensor lights that are helpful during the night. The bathroom also has a motion-sensored night light.
The hotel has a 24-hour airport shuttle that picks up twice per hour (10 minutes and 40 minutes after the hour).

children.text: The hotel airport shuttle runs every 30 minutes (:10 and :40).

title: Hyatt Regency Dulles Hotel Review

children.text: After arriving on a red-eye, it was great to catch the free hotel shuttle (Ubers were $22 for the less than 2-mile journey) to this airport hotel.  By airport hotel standards, for 5,00 Hyatt points a night (Category 1), this is a great base, with spacious rooms & friendly staff.

Quintessentially Chicago with a landmark address just steps from historic Water Tower Park and famed Michigan Avenue, you’ll find the reimagined Park Hyatt Chicago—a 5-star residential hotel for discerning global travelers seeking an authentic, downtown experience. -
Hyatt

negatives: Nomi breakfast options are limited, we went through all the menu items & were repeating our favorites during our 5-night stay.
View from the Lake View room was better than from the Chicago Avenue suite.
There was no tablet in our room during our 2nd stay. Staff noted it was removed for maintenance.
Wifi speed fluctuated from 15 to 50 mbps during our stay.
Chromecast would sign out randomly over the course of our stay & we'd have to resign in.
positives: During our first stay (January 2024), we realized we did not like the pillows, as they were too soft. Prior to our 2nd stay we requested 2 memory foam pillows which were more comfortable.
During our first stay (January 2024) we realized the room's only fridge was a stocked mini-fridge. Prior to our 2nd stay we requested a personal fridge, was in our room upon arrival & was very cold.
Spacious suite equipped with two full bathrooms, with a double sink & tub in the main bedroom. There is ample storage space in the dressing room.
Staff is very personable. Everyone we encountered, from the bellman to Nomi staff, remembered our names.
Good location close to many shops and restaurants.
title: Park Hyatt Chicago Review

children.text: After visiting in January 2024, spending two nights in a King Bed with Lakeview Room 1616, we came back for a 5-night stay. Our cash + points booking along with a suite upgrade was a great value for our June stay.  The Chicago Avenue suite was spacious and having two full bathrooms was a huge plus. We especially loved being able to request a personal fridge and memory foam pillows – it made our second stay even better than the first. While the breakfast options could be improved and the Wi-Fi was a bit spotty, the friendly staff and convenient location near shops and restaurants made it a great home base for exploring. Lastly, the value for the price was excellent, especially with our cash + points booking and suite upgrade. We'd definitely recommend this hotel for anyone (Hyatt Globalist in particular) looking for a comfortable and convenient stay.

negatives: Additional cost for transportation from the airport to the resort.
The beach is rocky & the waves are rough, and black flags warning not to enter the water.
Breakfast was ok, the fruit was frozen & selection was limited, although they did have an omelet station & green juices.
positives: All-inclusive beach resort, with many food & drink options.
Great Hyatt award redemption (20k points per night) with cash upgrade ($100/pn) to swim up room.
Spacious room with comfy beds.
Super friendly staff: we were lost and asked staff in an elevator for help, they got off the elevator & walked us to where we wanted to go.
Each restaurant & bar had drink specials listed, which made it very easy to try many concoctions. The drinks were strong & tasty, and great recommendations by the bartenders.
Large gym with outdoor section overlooking pool, with views of the ocean.
title: Hyatt Ziva Los Cabos Review

children.text: Overall we really loved this hotel. Great service and good food (outside of breakfast). The swim-up room was nice, however, next time I would book a higher-floor oceanfront room.

The Gate Hotel Tokyo is a stylish and modern hotel located in the heart of Tokyo, Japan. The hotel is within walking distance of many popular attractions, including the Imperial Palace, the Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden, and the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building. The Gate Hotel Tokyo offers a variety of amenities and services, including a rooftop bar with stunning views of the city, a fitness center, and a business center. The hotel also has a number of dining options, including a Japanese restaurant, a Western restaurant, and a cafe. The Gate Hotel Tokyo is the perfect place to stay for business or leisure travelers alike.

negatives: Streaming functionality did not, TV said there was a firmware issue but did not provide a way to resolve it. Unable to stream.
Breakfast on both days was the same, could get boring on a longer stay.
The outdoor space was constantly busy during our two-night stay.
positives: Close location to train station, with plenty of shops nearby. The hotel is near the Ginza district which can be busy.
There is a 4th-floor outdoor space off the lobby.
Free & fast wifi (~300 mbps)
Large room with double sink, shower & tub
In-room amenities: Night clothes, robes, slippers, coffee machine, fridge, and Bluetooth speaker
The gym was on the small side however had adequate equipment.
Western breakfast was a selection of French toast, eggs benedict, or croque monsieur along with a small buffet of pastries, fruit, and freshly squeezed orange juice.
Our 13th-floor room was near the premium lounge, however, it was not in use.
The hotel was very quiet. We never heard the trains at a nearby train station while in our room.
The hotel has both smoking & non-smoking rooms, however, I did not smell anything during our stay throughout the hotel.
Courteous staff. We did not have any issues during our stay, noting there was always someone available at the front desk if we had any questions.
title: The Gate Hotel Tokyo by HULIC Hotel Review

children.text: Good Tokyo base hotel as it is close to several train stations, and many restaurants. We booked through a travel agent & enjoyed our two-night stay in our 13th (top) floor room.

In the center of Charlotte, you’ll find our hotel minutes from The Market at 7th Street and the Spectrum Center. The Bank of America Stadium and the NASCAR Hall of Fame are nearby. We offer meeting space, a business center, free hot breakfast, and a fitness center. After a busy day, relax at our First Ward Social Bar and Kitchen. -
Homewood Suites by Hilton

negatives: Low water pressure in the shower, barely a trickle.
Thin walls, you can hear what's happening in the hallways.
Lots of construction in the area, and a homeless population. Would advise against walking alone at night.
Hotel only has valet parking at $45/night, which utilizes a nearby parking garage.
Bedroom has only 1 night table with limited outlets for use.
Wifi speed is 9, extremely slow for streaming which caused frequent video buffering.
Slow response to text messages.
Wall mounted AC, not central air with resulted in uneven heating/cooling of the room.
The motion-sensor light switch in the bathroom illuminated the room during early morning bathroom visits. We had to cover the sensor with tape to stop this from happening during our 3-night stay.
When looking for a spoon we found dirty cutlery & the dishwasher had a weird smell.
positives: Spacious studio suite with couch & kitchenette.
Keycard needed to access front doors & elevators.
Free coffee & hot water available in the lobby.
Well-equipped kitchenette with full fridge, dishwasher, plates & toaster.
Large gym with plenty of equipment, however, the gym was in the basement with minimal view/natural light.
Paid $502 (plus $76 in taxes) for our 3-night stay which was a good value for what we needed. In the future, I would look into staying at other hotels before staying here again.
title: Homewood Suites by Hilton Charlotte Uptown First Ward Hotel Review

children.text: This hotel offers a mixed experience. While the spacious suites, well-equipped kitchenettes, and good value for the price are definite positives, several drawbacks prevent a wholeheartedly positive recommendation. Issues like low water pressure, thin walls, slow WiFi, and a poorly functioning dishwasher detract from the overall experience. The lack of central air and inconvenient bathroom lighting further add to the list of cons.

Consider this hotel if spaciousness and a kitchenette are priorities and you plan to spend minimal time in the room. However, if amenities like strong water pressure, reliable WiFi, and a peaceful environment are important to you, explore alternative options.

Hyatt Regency JFK Airport at Resorts World New York is a 4-star hotel located in Queens, New York. It is just a short drive from John F. Kennedy International Airport and is also home to NYC's only casino, Resorts World Casino New York City. The hotel offers a variety of amenities, including a restaurant, bar, gym, and casino. It also has a free shuttle service to and from the airport. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Hyatt Regency JFK Airport at Resorts World New York is the perfect place to stay for both business and leisure travelers.

negatives: Location (4): No hotel shuttle & not close to JFK. The Lyft ride was 15 minutes & cost $27. For those looking for a short layover hotel, this is not ideal.

The water took a long time to warm up (in both showers). The first morning it ran for almost 8 minutes before it was warm. The 2nd night the bathroom near the hallway warmed up faster, however, the main bathroom took a long time. Not sure what the issue is.
The closet does not have a light. Something you don't notice until it's late at night & you need something from it.
The walls are thin. You can hear people outside on the street, people in the hallway. We had a connecting room & could hear our neighbor's entire conversation.
positives: Cleanliness (4.5): The room was clean, and housekeeping was seen deep cleaning each room & the floors smelled like Clorox. The room passed the blacklight test.
Service (4.5): Everyone we encountered was nice & greeted us. Clive went above & beyond our toiletry ask offering to bring us a microwave & larger fridge for our stay.

Bed comfort (4.5): The bed was comfortable, although on the softer side. There were two pillow types on the bed, one firmer than the other which helped get a good night's rest. We ordered two additional pillows, which were too soft.

Internet Speed (4.5): Free wifi had 48 Mbps. As a globalist, I am eligible for premium speeds for free ($9.99), which had over 50 Mbps speed. The first day the free wifi was 19 Mbps, which is why we upgraded to the premium the 2nd day.
Amenities (5): Two large TVs, Keurig coffee machine, mini-fridge, safe, robes, slippers, automatic curtains.
Hotel value (4.5): For the 3-night stay, rooms were around $250 a night. We booked using 12,000 points per night. After we booked the rate increased to 15,000 points per night.
Chromecast functionality works well. Easy to connect & no problems with streaming through the Hyatt app.
The hotel suggests guest text for requests. They were responsive answering questions within seconds.
Plenty of storage: lots of drawers for clothes.
The key card is needed to access the elevator.
The Hyatt Regency lounge was nicely stocked & had 24-hour access. The lounge included Natalie's Carrot & Orange juice, something I have never seen at any hotel lounge.
Close to the Aqueduct-N Conduit Av station. It was an easy 30-minute trip to Brooklyn on the A-train.
room: 1 Bedroom Suite with 1 King Bed | Room 301
title: Hyatt Regency JFK Airport At Resorts World New York Hotel Review

children.text: This is a great airport hotel, albeit noting that the hotel does not provide an airport shuttle. Rooms are nicely appointed & the Regency lounge has a good variety of food. Would stay here again if I had more than a 16-hour layover at JFK. Overall a fantastic stay & I would consider staying here as a base for access to Brooklyn, with the A train nearby.

"Steps from azure blue waters and soft sands of Waikiki Beach, Hyatt Regency Waikiki is directly across from the world-famous Duke Kahanamoku Statue, near Diamond Head Crater and centrally located in a
dynamic city center

. Enjoy personalized services with the spirit of Aloha, modern amenities, cultural activities, a swimming pool overlooking the Pacific Ocean, locally sourced dining specialties, and on-site boutiques. The resort provides the perfect place for those who want to make the most of their island experience and connect with the heart of Hawaii." ~
Hyatt

negatives: Rooms are dated with visible wear and tear
Beach equipment (towels, chairs) are not available prior to 730am. If you want to get an early start on the beach day, you will likely have to bring your own.
No robes provided - requested via app & they were promptly brought to the room

The connecting rooms automatically lock. When we arrived the connecting door was locked & we asked housekeeping to unlock it. The wind from the balcony slammed the door shut & we were unable to access the 2nd room. The same housekeeping attendant let us back in & then left the lock in the “closed” position to prevent future issues.
Rooms needed a bit more soundproofing. We are able to hear (and feel) when our neighbors open and closed their doors. Also, noise could be heard from the street 38 floors below.
For the size, the gym was rather small with machines in one space and free weights in another. In the mornings it was pretty packed & hard to use multiple types of equipment.
The hotel is very large and spread out between two towers.
YouTube TV Chromecast functionality was not working (known Hyatt/YouTube API issue)
The TV while large was a bit sluggish. You had to be directly in front of it in order to change the channel.
positives: Million-dollar, oceanfront balcony views.
Located across the street from Waikiki Beach.
On-site restaurants were open; the food, was expensive yet tasty.
The staff was friendly & accommodating.
The hotel is a self-contained resort with ample shopping located on the ground floor. They offered daily classes and activities including a biweekly Farmer’s Market.
Wifi had no issues doing Zoom calls on the balcony.
Shor buffet breakfast was good, with similar food to Regency Club, except Shor came with an omelet station.
Very responsive text feature.
Coin laundry is located on the 4th floor.
The daily $42 resort fee includes Go Pro rental with plenty of accessories.
Reasonably priced ($200 - $350/night) hotel for location and amenities. The Royal Hawaiian, across the street, starting price was $350/night.
title: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Hotel Review

children.text: Booked under Hyatt Privé at $415/night for a Two Queen Oceanfront. Used a Suite Upgrade to confirm into a Two Queen Family Suite. Would definitely return for the great location with tons of activities.
"Situated in the center of the strip, Waldorf Astoria Las Vegas offers luxury, grandeur and True Waldorf Service" -
Waldorf Astoria Las Vegas

negatives: The hotel ground floor area (not the 23rd lobby) smelled foul. During our stay, the doors remained open which may have accounted for the stench that wafted in.
Power outlets were only on one side of the bed.
In-room dining was available during limited hours (630  - 1130 am and 530 pm - 11 pm). There was no pre-order functionality.
Found a back brace behind the curtain, which made us question how thorough the room was cleaned.
Connecting room: could hear neighbors.
The water closet sink leaked.
The in-room safe battery was dying and could not be used.
Similar to the Four Seasons Miami, you take one elevator from the ground floor to the 23rd lobby where you switch to another set of elevators to access the guest rooms.

$45 daily resort fee inclusions: "Guest Internet access; fitness club access; fitness classes; pool services/experiences; house car service (2-mile radius); notary services (2 documents daily); local and toll-free calls."

After returning home we noticed we were charged twice by Waldorf. I contacted them on a Saturday morning & they were able to identify and quickly rectify the issue, stating the refund would be processed within 5 business days.
positives: Spacious Junior Suite with a large bathroom containing dual vanity, soaker tub, and shower.
Room amenities include a coffee machine, tea kettle, wine glasses, robes, and slippers.
Unprompted, housekeeping came by at 7 pm with complimentary ice and bottled water.
TV had Chromecast functionality that was easy to set up.
(Finally) a digital key that worked!
Keycard needed to access the elevator's guestroom floors.
Large in-room desk with ample power outlets.
Electronic controlled lights and blackout drapes.
Soundproofed windows allowed for a good night's sleep although we were located near many shops on the Las Vegas strip.
Aside from hearing our neighbors through the connecting room door, the floor was very quiet.
Requested a 2 pm late check-out and due to hotel occupancy was only offered a 1 pm check-out.
Good location in the heart of the strip close to a shopping mall, Walgreens, and plenty of restaurants.

In-room dining attendants were attentive and pleasant. While the menu was limited (I had my eye on a pappardelle short rib that was not available during our stay), the food we ordered was (pricey and) delicious.
While the gym was small, it offered plenty of equipment for a good workout.
Large pool with plenty of seating area.
The hotel text feature worked great with responses within 5 minutes.

There is only one fridge in the room, which contains the minibar items. The fridge is a normal dorm room mini-fridge which allowed us to empty it to store our items, then promptly restock it prior to check out.
title: Waldorf Astoria Las Vegas Review

children.text: After our one-night stay at the
Wynn
, we Ubered to Waldorf Astoria Las Vegas for a one-night stay. After spending one night at the Waldorf Astoria New York when I was a teenager, I was excited to revisit this hotel brand.

We booked a Strip View Room (506 sq ft) through a travel agent and were provided a complimentary upgrade to a Waldorf Junior Suite (646 sq ft). At check-in we were offered an upgrade to a Panorama Strip View One-Bedroom Suite (764 sq ft) for an additional $150, however, we declined.

Our one night cost $480 ($379 rate + $101 taxes and fees) which is an average price for the hotel. We stayed on Thursday night, and weekend rates (Friday/Saturday night) can command upwards of $800 per night plus the taxes and fees.

Sadly, the Waldorf Astoria Las Vegas (previously the Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas) did not live up to my memory of my stay at the Waldorf New York when I was younger. Overall, we had a great stay at a nice hotel with great staff members. With so many hotels in Vegas, we would only stay here again if there was a need to be in the particular vicinity for an event.
